vrPpIpPortRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPort components.

vrPpIpPortRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpPortRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPort component.

vrPpIpPortRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortRowStatus
vrPpIpPortRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPort components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortComponentName.name: vrPpIpPortComponentName
vrPpIpPortComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortStorageType
vrPpIpPortStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPort tables.

vrPpIpPortIndex.name: vrPpIpPortIndex
vrPpIpPortIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPort tables.

vrPpIpPortProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortProvTable
vrPpIpPortProvTable.description: This group contains provisionable attributes for IP ports.

vrPpIpPortMaxTxUnit.name: vrPpIpPortMaxTxUnit
vrPpIpPortMaxTxUnit.description: This attribute specifies the IP MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit) supported by this IpPort. The specified MTU must be within the valid range for the IpPort media type.

vrPpIpPortArpStatus.name: vrPpIpPortArpStatus
vrPpIpPortArpStatus.description: This attribute specifies whether ARP is enabled or disabled on this IpPort. If auto is specified, an appropriate value will be selected based on the IpPort media type.

vrPpIpPortProxyArpStatus.name: vrPpIpPortProxyArpStatus
vrPpIpPortProxyArpStatus.description: This attribute specifies whether Proxy ARP is enabled or disabled for this IpPort.

vrPpIpPortArpNoLearn.name: vrPpIpPortArpNoLearn
vrPpIpPortArpNoLearn.description: This attribute specifies whether or not dynamic host entries will be installed in the ARP table when ARP packets are received on this IpPort.

vrPpIpPortSendRedirect.name: vrPpIpPortSendRedirect
vrPpIpPortSendRedirect.description: This attribute specifies whether or not ICMP host redirects will be sent out this IpPort.

vrPpIpPortMulticastStatus.name: vrPpIpPortMulticastStatus
vrPpIpPortMulticastStatus.description: This attribute specifies whether or not IP multicast packets can be sent out this IpPort. If auto is specified, an appropriate value will be selected based on the IpPort media type.

vrPpIpPortRelayAddress.name: vrPpIpPortRelayAddress
vrPpIpPortRelayAddress.description: This attribute specifies a relay broadcast address for this IpPort. Each packet, received on this IpPort, meeting the relay broadcast criteria will be forwarded to the specified relay broadcast address. An relay address of all zero's indicates no relay broadcast address.

vrPpIpPortRelayBroadcast.name: vrPpIpPortRelayBroadcast
vrPpIpPortRelayBroadcast.description: This attribute specifies how packets, received on other IpPorts, meeting the relay broadcast criteria, will be forwarded out this IpPort. The three options are described as follows: enabled: packets will be forwarded out this IpPort. disabled: packets will not be forwarded out this IpPort. auto: packets will be forwarded out this IpPort only when the bridge state is forwarding.

vrPpIpPortLinkModel.name: vrPpIpPortLinkModel
vrPpIpPortLinkModel.description: This attribute specifies the link model to use when the media type for this IpPort is PPP (Point to Point Protocol). A value of localAreaNetwork causes IP to treat this IpPort like a LAN. A value of pointToPoint causes IP to treat this IpPort like two directly connected IP hosts. A value of loopback causes IP to treat this IpPort similar to a point-to-point, but the destination and source points are the same providing an always up interface.

vrPpIpPortLanModel.name: vrPpIpPortLanModel
vrPpIpPortLanModel.description: This attribute specifies the lan model to use for this IpPort.

vrPpIpPortEncap.name: vrPpIpPortEncap
vrPpIpPortEncap.description: This attribute specifies the encapsulation type to be used when sending packets out this IpPort. If auto is specified, an appropriate value is selected based on the IpPort media type. The values ieee8023 and ethernet can only be specified if the media type is ethernet. Otherwise, auto must be specified. For ethernet media type, the default encapsulation is ethernet.

vrPpIpPortIcmpMaskReply.name: vrPpIpPortIcmpMaskReply
vrPpIpPortIcmpMaskReply.description: This attribute specifies whether or not replies will be generated in response to ICMP Address Mask Requests received on this IpPort.

vrPpIpPortDirectedBroadcast.name: vrPpIpPortDirectedBroadcast
vrPpIpPortDirectedBroadcast.description: This attribute specifies whether or not directed broadcast to physical broadcast translation is enabled for incoming traffic on this IpPort. The IP router requirement (RFC1812) says this translation should be enabled; however, in some network environments, setting this attribute to disabled may prevent operational problem such as broadcast storms. Note that in some configuration, setting this attribute to disabled may cause Bootp to fail.

vrPpIpPortAssignedQos.name: vrPpIpPortAssignedQos
vrPpIpPortAssignedQos.description: This attribute specifies the initial Class of Service (CoS) given to each packet received on the IpPort. The CoS value n is used to select Vr/ <string> QosP/n. which determines the QualityofService-Profile to be used when the packet is forwarded. The intial CoS given to a packet by the assignedQoS attribute may be overriden under certain circumstances (see the description of the Vr Qosp component, the cosPolicyAssignment attribute on the IpPort and Ip components, and the ipCos attribute on any of the frameRelayDte staticDlci, frameRelayDte dynamicDlciDefaults, and atmMpe atmConnection components).

vrPpIpPortAllowMcastMacDest.name: vrPpIpPortAllowMcastMacDest
vrPpIpPortAllowMcastMacDest.description: This attribute specifies whether a multicast destination MAC address is valid on this IpPort or not. Enabling it is non-standard. It can be used for applications such as transparent server backup. Multicast destination MAC address is only supported on LAN media.

vrPpIpPortCosPolicyAssignment.name: vrPpIpPortCosPolicyAssignment
vrPpIpPortCosPolicyAssignment.description: This attribute specifies the CosPolicyGroup component this IpPort component is using. Assigning a particular policy group to the IpPort may override the effect of the assignedQos; this depends on the actual policies provisioned under the policy group.

vrPpIpPortMcastDomain.name: vrPpIpPortMcastDomain
vrPpIpPortMcastDomain.description: This attribute specifies the multicast domain index which all traffic coming in from this IpPort use. The numerical value of this attribute selects Vr/<string> Ip Mcast Domain/n.

vrPpIpPortMcastPolicyAssignment.name: vrPpIpPortMcastPolicyAssignment
vrPpIpPortMcastPolicyAssignment.description: This attribute specifies the policyGroup component that this IpPort component is using.

vrPpIpPortSresProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortSresProvTable
vrPpIpPortSresProvTable.description: This group contains the provisioned attributes for SourceRouteEndStation support.

vrPpIpPortSourceRouteEndStationSupport.name: vrPpIpPortSourceRouteEndStationSupport
vrPpIpPortSourceRouteEndStationSupport.description: This attribute is used to enable or disable support for SourceRouteEndStation (Sres). If set to enable, Sres will be supported on this protocol on this ProtocolPort (Pp). If set to disable, it will not be supported. An Sres component must be provisioned under the VirtualRouter if this attribute is set to enable. If this attribute is set to enable and this Pp has its linkToMedia attribute set, it must be linked to a LanApplication (La) that has its Framer interfaceName linked to a Fddi or TokenRing component.

vrPpIpPortAdminControlTable.name: vrPpIpPortAdminControlTable
vrPpIpPortAdminControlTable.description: This group includes the Administrative Control attribute. This attribute defines the current administrative state of this component.

vrPpIpPortSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrPpIpPortSnmpAdminStatus
vrPpIpPortSnmpAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and packet forwarding is allowed. The down state indicates the interface is not operational and packet forwarding is unavailable. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrPpIpPortOperTable.name: vrPpIpPortOperTable
vrPpIpPortOperTable.description: This group contains operational attributes for an IpPort.

vrPpIpPortMediaType.name: vrPpIpPortMediaType
vrPpIpPortMediaType.description: This attribute indicates the media type of this IpPort.

vrPpIpPortOperMtu.name: vrPpIpPortOperMtu
vrPpIpPortOperMtu.description: This attribute indicates the current operational IP MTU for this IpPort. Note that this value may be different than the provisioned maxTxUnit.

vrPpIpPortOperArpStatus.name: vrPpIpPortOperArpStatus
vrPpIpPortOperArpStatus.description: This attribute indicates the current operational ARP status. If the provisioned arpStatus is set to auto, then the IP application automatically determines the operArpStatus based on the IpPort media type.

vrPpIpPortOperMulticastStatus.name: vrPpIpPortOperMulticastStatus
vrPpIpPortOperMulticastStatus.description: This attribute indicates the current operational Multicast status. If the provisioned multicastStatus is set to auto, then the IP application automatically determines the operMulticastStatus based on the IpPort media type.

vrPpIpPortOperEncap.name: vrPpIpPortOperEncap
vrPpIpPortOperEncap.description: This attribute indicates the current operational encapsulation type. If the provisioned encap is set to auto, then the IP application automatically determines the operEncap based on the IpPort media type.

vrPpIpPortOperCosPolicyAssignment.name: vrPpIpPortOperCosPolicyAssignment
vrPpIpPortOperCosPolicyAssignment.description: This attribute specifies the CosPolicyGroup component this IpPort component is using.

vrPpIpPortRelayBcOperTable.name: vrPpIpPortRelayBcOperTable
vrPpIpPortRelayBcOperTable.description: This group contains operational attributes for an IpPort's RelayBc counters.

vrPpIpPortRelayAddressCount.name: vrPpIpPortRelayAddressCount
vrPpIpPortRelayAddressCount.description: This attribute indicates the number of frames received on this IpPort which were forwarded to the provisioned relayAddress for this port. This counter wraps to zero when it reaches it's maximum.

vrPpIpPortRelayBcCount.name: vrPpIpPortRelayBcCount
vrPpIpPortRelayBcCount.description: This attribute indicates the number of frames received on this port which were forwarded to the broadcastAddress on other IpPorts. This counter is incremented once for every frame received on this port regardless of how many other ports it was sent on. This counter wraps to zero when it reaches it's maximum.

vrPpIpPortStateTable.name: vrPpIpPortStateTable
vrPpIpPortStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

vrPpIpPortAdminState.name: vrPpIpPortAdminState
vrPpIpPortAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

vrPpIpPortOperationalState.name: vrPpIpPortOperationalState
vrPpIpPortOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

vrPpIpPortUsageState.name: vrPpIpPortUsageState
vrPpIpPortUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

vrPpIpPortOperStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortOperStatusTable
vrPpIpPortOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

vrPpIpPortSnmpOperStatus.name: vrPpIpPortSnmpOperStatus
vrPpIpPortSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortLogicalIf components.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortLogicalIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRowStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortLogicalIf components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfComponentName.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfComponentName
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfStorageType
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfAddressIndex.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfAddressIndex
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfAddressIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfProvTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfProvTable.description: This group contains attributes required to define an IpLogicalIf.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfNetMask.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfNetMask
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfNetMask.description: This attribute specifies the subnet mask for this IpLogicalIf. This attribute must be specified because the IP application will not automatically provide a default value.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfBroadcastAddress.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfBroadcastAddress
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfBroadcastAddress.description: This attribute specifies the broadcast address for this IpLogicalIf. This attribute is ignored if the IpPort mediaType is ppp (Point to Point Protocol). If the value is 0.0.0.0, the actual broadcast address will be derived from the IP address of this LogicalIf and the netmask attribute.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkDestinationAddres.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkDestinationAddress
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkDestinationAddres.description: This attribute specifies the address for the link destination for this IpLogicalIf. This attribute is only required if the IpPort media type is PPP (Point to Point Protocol).

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToPimSmCandidateR.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToPimSmCandidateRp
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToPimSmCandidateR.description: This attribute specifies a link to the CandidateRendezvousPoint component which uses this logicalIf as it's RendezvousPoint (Rp).

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToPimSmCandidateB.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToPimSmCandidateBsr
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToPimSmCandidateB.description: This attribute specifies a link to the CandidateBootstrapRouter component which uses this logicalIf as it's BootstrapRouter Interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpTabl.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpTabl.description: This attribute specifies a link to the component InwStaticRouteEntry which uses this logicalIf as it's OutInterface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpValu.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpValue
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpValu.description: This variable represents both the value and the index for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpTable.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpRowS.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpRowStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpRowS.description: This variable is used to control the addition and deletion of individual values of the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfLinkToMulStaticGpTable.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIf components.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRowStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIf components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfComponentName.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfComponentName
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfStorageType
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfIndex.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfIndex
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfProvTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfProvTable.description: This group of attributes identifies a provisionable set of attributes.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfAreaId.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfAreaId
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfAreaId.description: The area Id this Ospf interface belongs to.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfIfType.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfIfType
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfIfType.description: This attribute indicates the type of this Ospf interface. This interface type does not necessarily correlate with the type of the interface set on the logicalIf entry under IpPort.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfSnmpAdminStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfSnmpAdminStatus.description: The administrative status of this Ospf interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRtrPriority.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRtrPriority
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRtrPriority.description: The priority of this interface. Used in multi-access networks, this field is used in the designated router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the router is not eligible to become the designated router on this particular protocol port. In the event of a tie in this value, routers will use their routerId as a tie breaker.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTransitDelay.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTransitDelay
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTransitDelay.description: The estimated number of seconds it takes to transmit a link-state update packet over this interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRetransInterval.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRetransInterval
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRetransInterval.description: The number of seconds between link-state advertisements retransmissions, for adjacencies belonging to this interface. This value is also used when retransmitting database description and link-state request packets.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfHelloInterval.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfHelloInterval
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfHelloInterval.description: The length of time, in seconds, between the Hello packets that the router sends on the interface. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRtrDeadInterval.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRtrDeadInterval
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfRtrDeadInterval.description: The number of seconds that a router's hello packets have not been seen before it's neighbors declare the router down. This should be some multiple of the helloIntereval. This value must be the same for all routers attached to a common network.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfPollInterval.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfPollInterval
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfPollInterval.description: The largest time interval, in seconds, between the hello packets sent to an inactive non-broadcast multi-access neighbor.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfAuthKey.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfAuthKey
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfAuthKey.description: The Authentication Key. If the value of the attribute authType of an AreaEntry is simplePassword, and the authKey length is shorter than 8 octets, then the value of authKey will be left adjusted zero-filled to 8 octets.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfMulticastForwar.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfMulticastForwarding
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfMulticastForwar.description: The way multicasts should be forwarded on this interface; non forwarded, forwarded as data-link multicasts, or forwarded as data-link unicasts. Data-link multicasting is not meaningful on point-to-point and NBMA(No Broadcast Multi Access) interfaces, and setting this attribute to blocked effectively disables all multicast forwarding.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfOperTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfOperTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfOperTable.description: This group of attributes identifies operational state that this interface is performing.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfState.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfState
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfState.description: The state of the OSPF interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfDesignatedRoute.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfDesignatedRouter
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfDesignatedRoute.description: The Ip address of the designated router.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfBackupDesignate.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfBackupDesignatedRouter
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfBackupDesignate.description: The Ip address of the backup designated router

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfEvents.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfEvents
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfEvents.description: The number of times this OSPF interface has changed its state or an error has occurred.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfMetricTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfMetricTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfMetricTable.description: This group contains the operational metric attribute of this interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfMetric.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfMetric
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfMetric.description: This attribute indicates the metric being used by this OspfIf. The metric is derived in one of two ways: 1. If there is a TypeOfService component provisioned under this OspfIf component, then the value of the metric attribute is copied from the provisionable attribute tosMetric. 2. Otherwise, the metric is computed based on the interface speed. If the interface speed is greater than 100 Mbit/s, then the metric is 1. If the interface speed is less than 100 Mbit/s, then the metric is 100 Mbit/s divided by the interface speed. If the interface speed is unknown, then it is treated as 1.54 Mbit/s during the calculation. The value of interface speed is available by displaying the ifSpeed attribute of the corresponding IfTableEntry component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSRowStatusTab.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSRowStatusTab.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOS components.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSRowStatusEnt.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSRowStatusEnt.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOS component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSRowStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOS components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSComponentNam.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSComponentName
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSComponentNam.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSStorageType
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOS tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSMetricTosInd.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSMetricTosIndex
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSMetricTosInd.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOS tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSProvTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSProvTable.description: Identifies a provisionable set of attributes.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSTosMetric.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSTosMetric
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfTOSTosMetric.description: The metric using this typeOfService on this interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRowStatusTab.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRowStatusTab.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbr components.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRowStatusEnt.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRowStatusEnt.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbr component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRowStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbr components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrComponentNam.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrComponentName
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrComponentNam.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrStorageType
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbr tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrAddressIndex.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrAddressIndex
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrAddressIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbr tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrProvTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrProvTable.description: Identifies a group of Provisionable attributes.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrPriority.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrPriority
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrPriority.description: The priority of this neighbor in the designated router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the neighbor is not eligible to become the designated router on this particular network. The higher the number, the better are the chances of being a designated router.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrOperTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrOperTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrOperTable.description: Contains the Operational set of attributes for the Neighbor.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRtrId.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRtrId
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrRtrId.description: An Ip Address uniquely identifying the neighboring router in the Autonomous System.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrOptions.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrOptions
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrOptions.description: A bit mask corresponding to the neighbor's options field. Bit 0, if set, indicates that the area accepts and operates on external information, if zero, it is a stub area. Bit 1, if set, indicates that the system will operate on Type of Service metrics other than TOS 0. If zero, the neighbor will ignore all metrics except the TOS 0 metric. Bit 2, if set, indicates that the system is Network Multicast capable; i.e., that it implements OSPF Multicast Routing.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrState.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrState
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrState.description: The state of the relationship with this neighbor.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrEvents.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrEvents
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrEvents.description: The number of times this neighbor relationship has changed state, or an error has occurred.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrLsRetransQle.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrLsRetransQlen
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrLsRetransQle.description: The current length of the Retransmission queue.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrExchangeStat.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrExchangeStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrExchangeStat.description: Indicates the exchange status for a neighbor Entry.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrPermanance.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrPermanance
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfOspfIfNbrPermanance.description: This attribute displays how the neighbor became an entry.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIf components.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfRowStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIf components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfComponentName.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfComponentName
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfStorageType
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIndex.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIndex
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfProvTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfProvTable.description: This group contains the provisionable attributes of the RipIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfSnmpAdminStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfSnmpAdminStatus.description: Identifies the administrative status of this RipInterface. Setting this value to disabled will have the effect of rendering it inactive.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfMetric.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfMetric
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfMetric.description: This attribute is the RIP metric for this logical interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfSilentFlag.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfSilentFlag
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfSilentFlag.description: If the value of this attribute is set to true, the protocol will only listen to RIP updates, If set to false, then Rip will listen and send RIP updates.This attribute has been migrated to ifConfSend.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfPoisonReverseFla.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfPoisonReverseFlag
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfPoisonReverseFla.description: If the value of this attribute is set to true, then poison reverse algorithm is used when sending out the updates otherwise use split horizon only.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfFlashUpdateFlag.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfFlashUpdateFlag
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfFlashUpdateFlag.description: This attribute when set to true will send updates when updates are received; otherwise RIP will wait till the next update period.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNetworkRouteStat.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNetworkRouteStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNetworkRouteStat.description: This attribute determines what type of network routes will be sent and whether a default route will be generated for this RipInterface. Generated default routes will not go into the routing table, but are sent in the updates going out on the interface. The possible values for this attribute are: naturalNetWithOutDefaultRoute - This value will cause normal RIP network routes to be put in the update. This means that the address of logicalIf pertaining to this RipInterface knowledge is taken into account in determining if the subnetted network or the natural network is sent for any route going into this update. naturalNetWithDefaultRoute - Selecting this value will cause a default route to be generated with the value of the metric selected for the attribute defaultRouteMetric. defaultRouteOnly - Selection of this value causes the default route to be generated with the value of the metric selected for the attribute defaultRouteMetric. NOTE: No other routes will go in the update. subnetsOnly - selection of this value will cause only subnet information to be put in the update. No default routes will be generated or passed on. Only subnetted routes that are part of the same subnetted network that this logicalInterface is on will be put in the update. NOTE: this also effects receiving of updates on this interface. Only subnetted routes that are part of the same subnetted network that this logicalInterface is on will be accepted on a received RIP update on this RipInterface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfDefaultRouteMetr.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfDefaultRouteMetric
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfDefaultRouteMetr.description: This attribute identifies the metric value for the default route. This value is only used if the attribute networkRouteStatus is configured with a value of either naturalNetWithDefaultRoute or defaultRouteOnly

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfAcceptDefault.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfAcceptDefault
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfAcceptDefault.description: If this attribute is set to true, then accept the default route from this interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfConfSend.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfConfSend
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfConfSend.description: This attribute identifies what the router sends on this RipIf. ripVersion1 implies sending RIP updates compliant with RFC 1058. rip1Compatible implies broadcasting RIP-2 updates according to RFC 1058. ripVersion2 implies multicasting RIP-2 updates.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfConfReceive.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfConfReceive
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfConfReceive.description: This attribute identifies which version of RIP updates are to be accepted on this RipIf. Note that rip2 and rip1OrRip2 implies reception of multicast packets.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfStatTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfStatTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfStatTable.description: This group contains operational attributes of the RipIf component. These attributes are statistical data corresponding to the RIP-2 standard MIB (rfc 1724) rip2Status table.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfBadPacketRcv.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfBadPacketRcv
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfBadPacketRcv.description: This attribute counts the number of RIP response packets recieved by the RIP process which were subsequently discarded for any reason.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfBadRouteRcv.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfBadRouteRcv
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfBadRouteRcv.description: This attribute counts how many routes, in valid RIP packets, were ignored for any reason.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfTriggeredUpdat.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfTriggeredUpdates
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfIfTriggeredUpdat.description: This attribute counts the number of triggered updates actually sent on this interface. This explicitly does NOT include full updates sent containing new information.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrRowStatusTabl.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrRowStatusTabl.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbr components.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrRowStatusEntr.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrRowStatusEntr.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbr component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrRowStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbr components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrComponentName.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrComponentName
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrStorageType
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbr tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrIndex.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrIndex
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbrIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfRipIfNbr tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIf components.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfRowStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIf components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfComponentName.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfComponentName
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfStorageType
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfIndex.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfIndex
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfProvTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfProvTable.description: This group contains the provisionable attributes for the InwIpIgmpIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfVersion.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfVersion
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfVersion.description: This attribute specifies the IGMP protocol version running on this interface. v2 is the only supported version at this time.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQueryInterval.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQueryInterval
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQueryInterval.description: This attribute specifies the frequency at which IGMP Host-Query packets are transmitted on this interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQueryMaxRespTim.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQueryMaxRespTime
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQueryMaxRespTim.description: This attribute specifies the maximum query response time advertised in IGMPv2 queries on this interface. The number of seconds represented by the queryMaxRespTime must be less than the Query Interval.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfOperTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfOperTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfOperTable.description: This group contains the operational attributes of InwIpIgmpIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQuerier.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQuerier
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQuerier.description: This attribute indicates the address of the IGMP Querier on the IP subnet to which this interface is attached.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfWrongVersionQue.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfWrongVersionQuery
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfWrongVersionQue.description: This attribute indicates the number of queries received whose IGMP version does not match that configured for this interface. IGMP requires that all routers on a LAN be configured to run the same version of IGMP.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfJoins.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfJoins
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfJoins.description: This attribute indicates the number of times a group membership has been added on this interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfGroups.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfGroups
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfGroups.description: This attribute indicates the current number of entries for this interface in the cache table.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQuerierExpiryTi.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQuerierExpiryTime
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfIgmpIfQuerierExpiryTi.description: This attribute indicates the amount of time remaining before the other querier present timer expires. If the local system is the querier, the value of this object is zero.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIf components.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfRowStatus
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIf components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfComponentName.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfComponentName
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfStorageType
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfIndex.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfIndex
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIf tables.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfProvTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfProvTable.description: This group contains the provisionable attributes for the InwIpPimSmIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfHelloInterval.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfHelloInterval
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfHelloInterval.description: This attribute specifies the frequency at which PIM-SM hello messages are transmitted on this interface.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfOperTable.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfOperTable
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfOperTable.description: This group contains the operational attributes for the InwIpPimSmIf component.

vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfDesignatedRout.name: vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfDesignatedRouter
vrPpIpPortLogicalIfPimSmIfDesignatedRout.description: This attribute indicates the Designated Router on this PIM-SM interface. For point-to-point interfaces(wan media), this attribute has the value 0.0.0.0.

vrPpIpPortNsRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortNsRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortNsRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortNs components.

vrPpIpPortNsRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpPortNsRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortNsRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortNs component.

vrPpIpPortNsRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortNsRowStatus
vrPpIpPortNsRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortNs components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortNsComponentName.name: vrPpIpPortNsComponentName
vrPpIpPortNsComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortNsStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortNsStorageType
vrPpIpPortNsStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortNs tables.

vrPpIpPortNsIndex.name: vrPpIpPortNsIndex
vrPpIpPortNsIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortNs tables.

vrPpIpPortNsProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortNsProvTable
vrPpIpPortNsProvTable.description: This group contains the attributes required by NetSentry to be applied to all IP packets going through this IpPort.

vrPpIpPortNsIncomingFilter.name: vrPpIpPortNsIncomingFilter
vrPpIpPortNsIncomingFilter.description: An ASCII string which provides the name of the NetSentry filter which will be applied to all IP datagrams arriving from this IpPort.

vrPpIpPortNsOutgoingFilter.name: vrPpIpPortNsOutgoingFilter
vrPpIpPortNsOutgoingFilter.description: An ASCII string which provides the name of NetSentry filter which will be applied to all IP datagrams sent to this IpPort.

vrPpIpPortBootpPRowStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPRowStatusTable
vrPpIpPortBootpPRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrPpIpPortBootpP components.

vrPpIpPortBootpPRowStatusEntry.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPRowStatusEntry
vrPpIpPortBootpPRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrPpIpPortBootpP component.

vrPpIpPortBootpPRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPRowStatus
vrPpIpPortBootpPRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrPpIpPortBootpP components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrPpIpPortBootpPComponentName.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPComponentName
vrPpIpPortBootpPComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrPpIpPortBootpPStorageType.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPStorageType
vrPpIpPortBootpPStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrPpIpPortBootpP tables.

vrPpIpPortBootpPIndex.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPIndex
vrPpIpPortBootpPIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrPpIpPortBootpP tables.

vrPpIpPortBootpPProvTable.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPProvTable
vrPpIpPortBootpPProvTable.description: This group contains provisionable attributes for the BootpPort component.

vrPpIpPortBootpPRelayForwardStatus.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPRelayForwardStatus
vrPpIpPortBootpPRelayForwardStatus.description: This attribute controls how BOOTP request packets, received on another port, will be flooded out this port. If relayForwardStatus is enabled, BOOTP requests received on another port will be broadcast out this port. When relayForwardStatus is disabled, BOOTP requests will not be broadcast out this port. If auto is used, the bridge spanning tree database is used to determine if BOOTP requests should be broadcast out this port. Note that when using enabled, it is possible to create misconfigurations which will result in broadcast storms. When using this feature with multiple routers, make sure there are no broadcast forwarding loops. Using auto with bridge spanning tree is safer to use if the network is running bridge spanning tree. Note that for auto to have effect, bridge spanning tree must be running on the corresponding VirtualRouter ProtocolPort.

vrPpIpPortBootpPBootpLogicalInterface.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPBootpLogicalInterface
vrPpIpPortBootpPBootpLogicalInterface.description: This attribute identifies the logical interface whose address is to be the GIADDR of this BOOTP port. If not set, the address of the first logical port is chosen.

vrPpIpPortBootpPAdminControlTable.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPAdminControlTable
vrPpIpPortBootpPAdminControlTable.description: This group includes the Administrative Control attribute. This attribute defines the current administrative state of this component.

vrPpIpPortBootpPSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPSnmpAdminStatus
vrPpIpPortBootpPSnmpAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and packet forwarding is allowed. The down state indicates the interface is not operational and packet forwarding is unavailable. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrPpIpPortBootpPOperStatusTable.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPOperStatusTable
vrPpIpPortBootpPOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

vrPpIpPortBootpPSnmpOperStatus.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPSnmpOperStatus
vrPpIpPortBootpPSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrPpIpPortBootpPStateTable.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPStateTable
vrPpIpPortBootpPStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

vrPpIpPortBootpPAdminState.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPAdminState
vrPpIpPortBootpPAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

vrPpIpPortBootpPOperationalState.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPOperationalState
vrPpIpPortBootpPOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

vrPpIpPortBootpPUsageState.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPUsageState
vrPpIpPortBootpPUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

vrPpIpPortBootpPStatsTable.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPStatsTable
vrPpIpPortBootpPStatsTable.description: This group contains BootpPortEntry component statistics.

vrPpIpPortBootpPInRequests.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPInRequests
vrPpIpPortBootpPInRequests.description: This attribute counts the total number of BOOTP Request messages received on this port.

vrPpIpPortBootpPInReplies.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPInReplies
vrPpIpPortBootpPInReplies.description: This attribute counts the total number of BOOTP Reply messages received on this port.

vrPpIpPortBootpPOutRequests.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPOutRequests
vrPpIpPortBootpPOutRequests.description: This attribute counts total the number of BOOTP Request messages broadcast out on this port.

vrPpIpPortBootpPOutReplies.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPOutReplies
vrPpIpPortBootpPOutReplies.description: This attribute counts the total number of BOOTP Reply messages sent out on this port.

vrPpIpPortBootpPInRequestErrors.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPInRequestErrors
vrPpIpPortBootpPInRequestErrors.description: This attribute counts the number of BOOTP Request messages received on this port but not forwarded due to an error. An error occurs if the BOOTP hop limit has been exceeded.

vrPpIpPortBootpPInReplyErrors.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPInReplyErrors
vrPpIpPortBootpPInReplyErrors.description: This attribute counts the number of BOOTP Reply messages received on this port but not forwarded due to an error. An error occurs if the giaddr field in the BOOTP reply does not match an IP address assigned to this VirtualRouter, or if the output IpPort for the BOOTP reply is not provisioned for BOOTP.

vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrTable.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrTable
vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrTable.description: This attribute identifies a list of relay addresses. When a BOOTP request message is received on this port, the request will be forwarded to the IP addresses provisioned in relayAddress. Note that BOOTP requests are also broadcast out all other BootpPort's according to the relayForwardStatus of the outgoing port.

vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrValue.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrValue
vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrValue.description: This variable represents both the value and the index for the vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrTable.

vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrRowStatus.name: vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrRowStatus
vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrRowStatus.description: This variable is used to control the addition and deletion of individual values of the vrPpIpPortBootpPAddrTable.

vrIpRowStatusTable.name: vrIpRowStatusTable
vrIpRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIp components.

vrIpRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpRowStatusEntry
vrIpRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIp component.

vrIpRowStatus.name: vrIpRowStatus
vrIpRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIp components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpComponentName.name: vrIpComponentName
vrIpComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpStorageType.name: vrIpStorageType
vrIpStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIp tables.

vrIpIndex.name: vrIpIndex
vrIpIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIp tables.

vrIpProvTable.name: vrIpProvTable
vrIpProvTable.description: This group contains global attributes for IP.

vrIpForwarding.name: vrIpForwarding
vrIpForwarding.description: This attribute indicates whether or not this VR is acting as an IP gateway in respect to the forwarding of datagrams received by, but not addressed to, this VR

vrIpDefaultTtl.name: vrIpDefaultTtl
vrIpDefaultTtl.description: This attribute is the default value inserted into the Time-To-Live field of the IP header of datagrams originated at this entity, whenever a Time- To-Live value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol. The value of this attribute deviates from the MIB requirement that it will always have a value of 255.

vrIpCosPolicyAssignment.name: vrIpCosPolicyAssignment
vrIpCosPolicyAssignment.description: This attribute specifies the default cosPolicyGroup component that is associated with the IpPort of every protocol port on the vrirtual router. An individual IpPort can override this default using its own cosPolicyAssignment attribute. If this attribute is empty, CoS policy groups are assigned to only those IP ports where the cosPolicyAssignment attribute under the IpPort component is non-empty.

vrIpStatsTable.name: vrIpStatsTable
vrIpStatsTable.description: This is the GROUP holding the struct which contains statistical attributes for IP.

vrIpInReceives.name: vrIpInReceives
vrIpInReceives.description: This is the number of input datagrams received from the interfaces, including those received in error . inReceives wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpInHdrErrors.name: vrIpInHdrErrors
vrIpInHdrErrors.description: The number of input datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including bad checksums, version number mismatch, other format errors, time-to-live exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc. inHdrErrors wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpInAddrErrors.name: vrIpInAddrErrors
vrIpInAddrErrors.description: The number of input datagrams discarded due to errors such as invalid address, unsupported address class. inAddrErrors wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpForwDatagrams.name: vrIpForwDatagrams
vrIpForwDatagrams.description: The number of input datagrams for which this router was not their final IP destination, as a result of which an attempt was made to find a route to forward them to that final destination. forwDatagrams wraps to zero if reaches it's maximum defined value.

vrIpInUnknownProtos.name: vrIpInUnknownProtos
vrIpInUnknownProtos.description: The number of locally-addressed datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol inUnknownProtos wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpInDiscards.name: vrIpInDiscards
vrIpInDiscards.description: The number of input datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but which were discarded due to the lack of buffers. This does not include any datagram discarded while awaiting for re-assembly. inDiscards wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpInDelivers.name: vrIpInDelivers
vrIpInDelivers.description: The number of input datagrams successfully delivered to IP user- protocols (including ICMP). inDelivers wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpOutRequests.name: vrIpOutRequests
vrIpOutRequests.description: The number of datagrams which local IP user-protocols (including ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. This sum does not include datagrams counted in ForwDatagrams. outRequests wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpOutDiscards.name: vrIpOutDiscards
vrIpOutDiscards.description: The number of outbound datagrams that were discarded due to the lack of buffers. This sum also includes datagrams counted in forwDatagrams if any such packets met the discard criterion. outDiscards wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpOutNoRoutes.name: vrIpOutNoRoutes
vrIpOutNoRoutes.description: The number of outbound datagrams discarded because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination. This counter includes any datagrams counted in forwDatagrams. outNoRoutes wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpReasmTimeOut.name: vrIpReasmTimeOut
vrIpReasmTimeOut.description: The maximum number of seconds, which received fragments are held while they are awaiting reassembly at this gateway.

vrIpReasmReqds.name: vrIpReasmReqds
vrIpReasmReqds.description: The number of the IP fragments received by this gateway which needed to be reassembled. reasmReqds wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpReasmOks.name: vrIpReasmOks
vrIpReasmOks.description: The number of IP fragments successfully reassembled by this gateway. reasmOks wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpReasmFails.name: vrIpReasmFails
vrIpReasmFails.description: The number of times this gateway is unabled to assemble IP-fragments for whatever reasons. reasmFails wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpFragOks.name: vrIpFragOks
vrIpFragOks.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been successfully fragmented by this gateway. fragOks wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpFragFails.name: vrIpFragFails
vrIpFragFails.description: The number of IP-fragments that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented but could not be. For example, their Don't Fragment flag was set. fragFails wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpFragCreates.name: vrIpFragCreates
vrIpFragCreates.description: This number of IP fragments that have been generated as a result of fragmentation by this gateway. fragCreates wraps to zero if reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpRoutingDiscards.name: vrIpRoutingDiscards
vrIpRoutingDiscards.description: The number of routing entries which were chosen to be discarded even though they are valid. One possible reason for discarding such an entry could be to free -up buffer space for other routing entries. In this implementation, this number is always zero because IP never deletes a valid routing entry.

vrIpAdminControlTable.name: vrIpAdminControlTable
vrIpAdminControlTable.description: This group includes the Administrative Control attribute. This attribute defines the current administrative state of this component.

vrIpSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrIpSnmpAdminStatus
vrIpSnmpAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and packet forwarding is allowed. The down state indicates the interface is not operational and packet forwarding is unavailable. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrIpStateTable.name: vrIpStateTable
vrIpStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

vrIpAdminState.name: vrIpAdminState
vrIpAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

vrIpOperationalState.name: vrIpOperationalState
vrIpOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

vrIpUsageState.name: vrIpUsageState
vrIpUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

vrIpOperStatusTable.name: vrIpOperStatusTable
vrIpOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

vrIpSnmpOperStatus.name: vrIpSnmpOperStatus
vrIpSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrIpCtsTable.name: vrIpCtsTable
vrIpCtsTable.description: This attribute specifies the maximum number of entries that can exist in the IP local cache table on each LP. This attribute provides a way to control the resources allocated to the IP cache tables. The default cache table size is 3000 for an FP and 100 for a CP, is used if this attribute is not specified explicitly. The attribute value must be multiple of 100.

vrIpCtsIndex.name: vrIpCtsIndex
vrIpCtsIndex.description: This variable represents the vrIpCtsTable specific index for the vrIpCtsTable.

vrIpCtsValue.name: vrIpCtsValue
vrIpCtsValue.description: This variable represents an individual value for the vrIpCtsTable.

vrIpFwdRowStatusTable.name: vrIpFwdRowStatusTable
vrIpFwdRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpFwd components.

vrIpFwdRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpFwdRowStatusEntry
vrIpFwdRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpFwd component.

vrIpFwdRowStatus.name: vrIpFwdRowStatus
vrIpFwdRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpFwd components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrIpFwdComponentName.name: vrIpFwdComponentName
vrIpFwdComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpFwdStorageType.name: vrIpFwdStorageType
vrIpFwdStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpFwd tables.

vrIpFwdDestAddressIndex.name: vrIpFwdDestAddressIndex
vrIpFwdDestAddressIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpFwd tables.

vrIpFwdDestMaskIndex.name: vrIpFwdDestMaskIndex
vrIpFwdDestMaskIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpFwd tables.

vrIpFwdTypeOfServiceIndex.name: vrIpFwdTypeOfServiceIndex
vrIpFwdTypeOfServiceIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpFwd tables.

vrIpFwdGatewayIndex.name: vrIpFwdGatewayIndex
vrIpFwdGatewayIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpFwd tables.

vrIpFwdOperTable.name: vrIpFwdOperTable
vrIpFwdOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** Identifies a group of operational attributes associated with each entry in the Forward Table.

vrIpFwdIfIndex.name: vrIpFwdIfIndex
vrIpFwdIfIndex.description: This attribute specifies the SNMP index associated with the protocol port represented by the attribute protocolPortName, which identifies the local interface through which the next hop of this route should be reached.

vrIpFwdType.name: vrIpFwdType
vrIpFwdType.description: Specifies the type of the route,

vrIpFwdProtocol.name: vrIpFwdProtocol
vrIpFwdProtocol.description: This Attribute identifies the routing mechanism by which this route was learned.

vrIpFwdAge.name: vrIpFwdAge
vrIpFwdAge.description: This attribute specifies the number of seconds since this route was last updated or otherwise determined to be correct.

vrIpFwdProtocolPortName.name: vrIpFwdProtocolPortName
vrIpFwdProtocolPortName.description: Indicates the name of the protocol port by which the next hop of this route should be reached.

vrIpFwdNextHopAs.name: vrIpFwdNextHopAs
vrIpFwdNextHopAs.description: This attribute specifies the Autonomous System number of the Next Hop. If unknown or not relevant to the protocol indicated by the attribute protocol, the value should be zero.

vrIpFwdMetric.name: vrIpFwdMetric
vrIpFwdMetric.description: This attribute specifies the primary routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing protocol specified by the value of the attribute protocol. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

vrIpRdbRowStatusTable.name: vrIpRdbRowStatusTable
vrIpRdbRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpRdb components.

vrIpRdbRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpRdbRowStatusEntry
vrIpRdbRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpRdb component.

vrIpRdbRowStatus.name: vrIpRdbRowStatus
vrIpRdbRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpRdb components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrIpRdbComponentName.name: vrIpRdbComponentName
vrIpRdbComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpRdbStorageType.name: vrIpRdbStorageType
vrIpRdbStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpRdb tables.

vrIpRdbDestAddressIndex.name: vrIpRdbDestAddressIndex
vrIpRdbDestAddressIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpRdb tables.

vrIpRdbDestMaskIndex.name: vrIpRdbDestMaskIndex
vrIpRdbDestMaskIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpRdb tables.

vrIpRdbProtocolIndex.name: vrIpRdbProtocolIndex
vrIpRdbProtocolIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpRdb tables.

vrIpRdbGatewayIndex.name: vrIpRdbGatewayIndex
vrIpRdbGatewayIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpRdb tables.

vrIpRdbOperTable.name: vrIpRdbOperTable
vrIpRdbOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** Identifies a group of operational attributes associated with each entry in the routing database.

vrIpRdbMetric.name: vrIpRdbMetric
vrIpRdbMetric.description: This attribute specifies the primary routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing protocol specified by the value of the index to this entry protocol. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

vrIpRdbPreference.name: vrIpRdbPreference
vrIpRdbPreference.description: This attribute specifies the the preference value of this particular entry. The value of this attribute affects the way the routeEntries in this database are selected for installing it in the forwardingTable. The lower the preference value of this entry, the higher are the chances that this entry will be selected to install in the ForwardTable.

vrIpRdbAge.name: vrIpRdbAge
vrIpRdbAge.description: This attribute specifies the number of seconds since this route was last updated or otherwise determined to be correct.

vrIpIfRowStatusTable.name: vrIpIfRowStatusTable
vrIpIfRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpIf components.

vrIpIfRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpIfRowStatusEntry
vrIpIfRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpIf component.

vrIpIfRowStatus.name: vrIpIfRowStatus
vrIpIfRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpIf components. These components cannot be added nor deleted.

vrIpIfComponentName.name: vrIpIfComponentName
vrIpIfComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpIfStorageType.name: vrIpIfStorageType
vrIpIfStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpIf tables.

vrIpIfInterfaceAddressIndex.name: vrIpIfInterfaceAddressIndex
vrIpIfInterfaceAddressIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpIf tables.

vrIpIfOperTable.name: vrIpIfOperTable
vrIpIfOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** Identifies a group of operational attributes associated with each entry in the Ip interface table.

vrIpIfInterfaceMask.name: vrIpIfInterfaceMask
vrIpIfInterfaceMask.description: This attribute indicates the mask for this interface entry.

vrIpIfStatus.name: vrIpIfStatus
vrIpIfStatus.description: This attribute specifies the status of the provisioned Ip logicalInterface entry. A value of disabled is used when the parent components Vr, Ip or ipPort is in a disabled state. A value of up is used when the interface is in an operational state. A state of down is used if the media associated with this interface is not ready or disabled.

vrIpIfPPName.name: vrIpIfPPName
vrIpIfPPName.description: Indicates the name of the protocol port this logicalIfEntry belongs to.

vrIpIfMediaType.name: vrIpIfMediaType
vrIpIfMediaType.description: This attribute indicates the media type of interface. When the interface is down, a value of none indicates the media stays down from the beginning. When the interface is down, a value of some valid media type indicates the media is brought down after it was up. Otherwise, when the interface is up or disabled, this attribute should reflect the proper media type of the interface.

vrIpIfHardwareAddress.name: vrIpIfHardwareAddress
vrIpIfHardwareAddress.description: This attribute specifies the hardware address of the media in canonical form if applicable. The non-canonical version of this address is indicated in ncHardwareAddress.

vrIpIfMtu.name: vrIpIfMtu
vrIpIfMtu.description: This attribute specifies the maximum transmission unit applicable for this logicalInterface. A value of 0 is used for the interfaces where all the necessary information is not available to compute the mtu applicable for this interface.

vrIpIfBroadcastAddress.name: vrIpIfBroadcastAddress
vrIpIfBroadcastAddress.description: This attribute indicates the destination IP address to be used by any application which needs to broadcast on this interface. The value is determined by the corresponding LogicalIf component's broadcastAddress attribute.

vrIpIfNcHardwareAddress.name: vrIpIfNcHardwareAddress
vrIpIfNcHardwareAddress.description: This attribute is the non-canonical version of hardwareAddress. This attribute is not displayed for interfaces on non-LAN media.

vrIpEgpRowStatusTable.name: vrIpEgpRowStatusTable
vrIpEgpRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpEgp components.

vrIpEgpRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpEgpRowStatusEntry
vrIpEgpRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpEgp component.

vrIpEgpRowStatus.name: vrIpEgpRowStatus
vrIpEgpRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpEgp components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpEgpComponentName.name: vrIpEgpComponentName
vrIpEgpComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpEgpStorageType.name: vrIpEgpStorageType
vrIpEgpStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpEgp tables.

vrIpEgpIndex.name: vrIpEgpIndex
vrIpEgpIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpEgp tables.

vrIpEgpProvTable.name: vrIpEgpProvTable
vrIpEgpProvTable.description: This group contains the provisionable attributes for the EGP component

vrIpEgpAsId.name: vrIpEgpAsId
vrIpEgpAsId.description: The autonomous system identifier for this EGP entity. The value of this asId can not be equal to the value of EgpNeighborEntry asId.

vrIpEgpDefaultHelloInterval.name: vrIpEgpDefaultHelloInterval
vrIpEgpDefaultHelloInterval.description: This attribute is used to configure the default hello interval for each neighbor. This attribute's value is used by the application for each EgpNeighbor whose helloInterval has not been set.

vrIpEgpDefaultPollInterval.name: vrIpEgpDefaultPollInterval
vrIpEgpDefaultPollInterval.description: This attribute is used to configure the default polling interval for the EGP Neighbor. This attribute's value is used by the application for each EgpNeighbor whose pollInterval has not been set.

vrIpEgpMaxNatNets.name: vrIpEgpMaxNatNets
vrIpEgpMaxNatNets.description: This attribute is used to configure the maximum number of external natural networks this virtual router will be advertising via EGP.

vrIpEgpMaxBufferSize.name: vrIpEgpMaxBufferSize
vrIpEgpMaxBufferSize.description: This attribute specifies the maximum buffer size (in 1024 byte memory blocks) to be used for an EGP update to be sent.

vrIpEgpStatsTable.name: vrIpEgpStatsTable
vrIpEgpStatsTable.description: These set of attributes identifies the statistics for the EGP component.

vrIpEgpInMsgs.name: vrIpEgpInMsgs
vrIpEgpInMsgs.description: Identifies the number of EGP messages received without error. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpInErrorMsgs.name: vrIpEgpInErrorMsgs
vrIpEgpInErrorMsgs.description: Identifies the sum of EGP error messages from all the neighbors. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpOutErrorMsgs.name: vrIpEgpOutErrorMsgs
vrIpEgpOutErrorMsgs.description: Indicates the sum of Egp error messages sent to all the neighbors. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpInErrors.name: vrIpEgpInErrors
vrIpEgpInErrors.description: Identifies the number of EGP messages that proved to be in error. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpOutMsgs.name: vrIpEgpOutMsgs
vrIpEgpOutMsgs.description: The total number of locally generated EGP messages. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpOutErrors.name: vrIpEgpOutErrors
vrIpEgpOutErrors.description: The number of EGP messages that were locally generated but were not sent out due to resource limitations within an EGP entity.This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpStateTable.name: vrIpEgpStateTable
vrIpEgpStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

vrIpEgpAdminState.name: vrIpEgpAdminState
