vrIpEgpAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

vrIpEgpOperationalState.name: vrIpEgpOperationalState
vrIpEgpOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

vrIpEgpUsageState.name: vrIpEgpUsageState
vrIpEgpUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

vrIpEgpAdminControlTable.name: vrIpEgpAdminControlTable
vrIpEgpAdminControlTable.description: This group includes the Administrative Control attribute. This attribute defines the current administrative state of this component.

vrIpEgpSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrIpEgpSnmpAdminStatus
vrIpEgpSnmpAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and packet forwarding is allowed. The down state indicates the interface is not operational and packet forwarding is unavailable. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrIpEgpOperStatusTable.name: vrIpEgpOperStatusTable
vrIpEgpOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

vrIpEgpSnmpOperStatus.name: vrIpEgpSnmpOperStatus
vrIpEgpSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrIpEgpNbrRowStatusTable.name: vrIpEgpNbrRowStatusTable
vrIpEgpNbrRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpEgpNbr components.

vrIpEgpNbrRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpEgpNbrRowStatusEntry
vrIpEgpNbrRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpEgpNbr component.

vrIpEgpNbrRowStatus.name: vrIpEgpNbrRowStatus
vrIpEgpNbrRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpEgpNbr components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpEgpNbrComponentName.name: vrIpEgpNbrComponentName
vrIpEgpNbrComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpEgpNbrStorageType.name: vrIpEgpNbrStorageType
vrIpEgpNbrStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpEgpNbr tables.

vrIpEgpNbrNeighborAddressIndex.name: vrIpEgpNbrNeighborAddressIndex
vrIpEgpNbrNeighborAddressIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpEgpNbr tables.

vrIpEgpNbrProvTable.name: vrIpEgpNbrProvTable
vrIpEgpNbrProvTable.description: This group of attributes identify the provisionable attributes for this EGP neighbor.

vrIpEgpNbrAsId.name: vrIpEgpNbrAsId
vrIpEgpNbrAsId.description: The autonomous system identifier of this EGP peer. The value of this neighbor's asId should not be equal to the asId value of Egp entity

vrIpEgpNbrMode.name: vrIpEgpNbrMode
vrIpEgpNbrMode.description: This attribute will indicate whether this neighbor is being configured as an active or passive neighbor.

vrIpEgpNbrGenerateDefaultRoute.name: vrIpEgpNbrGenerateDefaultRoute
vrIpEgpNbrGenerateDefaultRoute.description: This attribute distinguishes whether or not the default route should be generated. This route is put in the EGP update along with the normal EGP update routes when updates are sent to this EGP neighbor

vrIpEgpNbrDefaultRouteMetric.name: vrIpEgpNbrDefaultRouteMetric
vrIpEgpNbrDefaultRouteMetric.description: This attribute identifies the Metric to be used for propagating the 'Default Route'. The value of defaultRouteMetric is used only in the case where the value of the attribute generateDefaultRoute is set to yes.

vrIpEgpNbrDefaultMetric.name: vrIpEgpNbrDefaultMetric
vrIpEgpNbrDefaultMetric.description: This attribute identifies the default metric value for routes that are exported to this EgpNeighbor. This value is used when exporting routes to this neighbor and no Export policy applies a different metric.

vrIpEgpNbrHelloInterval.name: vrIpEgpNbrHelloInterval
vrIpEgpNbrHelloInterval.description: This attribute identifies the interval in seconds, between EGP hello command retransmissions. This is the P1 timer in the RFC904. This value may change in operation due to negotiations.

vrIpEgpNbrPollInterval.name: vrIpEgpNbrPollInterval
vrIpEgpNbrPollInterval.description: This attribute identifies the interval in seconds, between EGP poll command retransmissions. This is the P2 timer in the RFC904. This value may change in operation due to negotiations.

vrIpEgpNbrOperTable.name: vrIpEgpNbrOperTable
vrIpEgpNbrOperTable.description: This group of attributes identifies the operational set of attributes for the NeighborEntry component.

vrIpEgpNbrState.name: vrIpEgpNbrState
vrIpEgpNbrState.description: This attribute describes the state of the local system with respect to this entry's EGP Neighbor.

vrIpEgpNbrInMsgs.name: vrIpEgpNbrInMsgs
vrIpEgpNbrInMsgs.description: The number of EGP messages received without error from the EGP peer. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpNbrInErrors.name: vrIpEgpNbrInErrors
vrIpEgpNbrInErrors.description: The number of messages received from this EGP peer that proved to be in error. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpNbrOutMsgs.name: vrIpEgpNbrOutMsgs
vrIpEgpNbrOutMsgs.description: The number of locally generated EGP messages for this EGP peer. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpNbrOutErrors.name: vrIpEgpNbrOutErrors
vrIpEgpNbrOutErrors.description: The number of locally generated EGP messages not sent to this EGP peer due to resource limitations within an EGP entity.This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpNbrInErrorMsgs.name: vrIpEgpNbrInErrorMsgs
vrIpEgpNbrInErrorMsgs.description: The number of EGP-defined error messages received from this EGP peer.This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpNbrOutErrorMsgs.name: vrIpEgpNbrOutErrorMsgs
vrIpEgpNbrOutErrorMsgs.description: The number of EGP-defined error messages sent to this EGP peer.This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpNbrStateUps.name: vrIpEgpNbrStateUps
vrIpEgpNbrStateUps.description: The number of EGP state transitions to the UP state with this EGP peer. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpNbrStateDowns.name: vrIpEgpNbrStateDowns
vrIpEgpNbrStateDowns.description: The number of EGP state transitions from the UP state to any other state with this EGP peer. This counter will wraparound once the value reaches the maximum value.

vrIpEgpNbrEventTrigger.name: vrIpEgpNbrEventTrigger
vrIpEgpNbrEventTrigger.description: This attribute is used to control the state of the Neighbor. It is not allowed to change. This attribute from SNMP perspective deviates from MIB that it is made READONLY.

vrIpEgpImportRowStatusTable.name: vrIpEgpImportRowStatusTable
vrIpEgpImportRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpEgpImport components.

vrIpEgpImportRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpEgpImportRowStatusEntry
vrIpEgpImportRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpEgpImport component.

vrIpEgpImportRowStatus.name: vrIpEgpImportRowStatus
vrIpEgpImportRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpEgpImport components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpEgpImportComponentName.name: vrIpEgpImportComponentName
vrIpEgpImportComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpEgpImportStorageType.name: vrIpEgpImportStorageType
vrIpEgpImportStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpEgpImport tables.

vrIpEgpImportIndex.name: vrIpEgpImportIndex
vrIpEgpImportIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpEgpImport tables.

vrIpEgpImportProvTable.name: vrIpEgpImportProvTable
vrIpEgpImportProvTable.description: These set of attributes describe the provisionable attributes for the import component.

vrIpEgpImportUsageFlag.name: vrIpEgpImportUsageFlag
vrIpEgpImportUsageFlag.description: This flag will determine whether or not EGP will use or ignore information in updates received. If the attribute nbrAsId is not specified or any of the NetworkList components are not added, then this attribute when set to ignore will ignore all incoming information.

vrIpEgpImportImportMetric.name: vrIpEgpImportImportMetric
vrIpEgpImportImportMetric.description: This attribute is used to set the metric value to be included in the routing table for any routes sent because this particular import instance was it's 'best match' policy. However this attribute is not a selection key. It should not use or ignore a particular metric value. If the value for this attribute is not specified, then the metric value received in an Egp update will be used. Note: When setting this value, caution should be taken to set the metric value in all relevant Import components to make sure that all matching policies for a given route have the same metric set. This will insure that there are no situations where a specific metric was desired, but doesn't get used in the update because the 'best match' policy for that situation did not set the metric parameter. If the attribute usageFlag for this import policy is set to ignore, then the importMetric value will be ignored by the application. The importMetric value is not used to select which routes to use or ignore but is used to set the metric value for the routes being imported. A value of zero indicates that the metric received in the update will be used.

vrIpEgpImportNbrAsId.name: vrIpEgpImportNbrAsId
vrIpEgpImportNbrAsId.description: The autonomous system Id this import policy will apply to. Note: The Valid value of an asId is from 1 to 65,535. This attribute's value when set to 0 will be ignored.

vrIpEgpImportNetRowStatusTable.name: vrIpEgpImportNetRowStatusTable
vrIpEgpImportNetRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpEgpImportNet components.

vrIpEgpImportNetRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpEgpImportNetRowStatusEntry
vrIpEgpImportNetRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpEgpImportNet component.

vrIpEgpImportNetRowStatus.name: vrIpEgpImportNetRowStatus
vrIpEgpImportNetRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpEgpImportNet components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpEgpImportNetComponentName.name: vrIpEgpImportNetComponentName
vrIpEgpImportNetComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpEgpImportNetStorageType.name: vrIpEgpImportNetStorageType
vrIpEgpImportNetStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpEgpImportNet tables.

vrIpEgpImportNetIndex.name: vrIpEgpImportNetIndex
vrIpEgpImportNetIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpEgpImportNet tables.

vrIpEgpImportNetProvTable.name: vrIpEgpImportNetProvTable
vrIpEgpImportNetProvTable.description: This group identifies attributes for the NetworkList component for which the import policy will be applied to

vrIpEgpImportNetIpAddress.name: vrIpEgpImportNetIpAddress
vrIpEgpImportNetIpAddress.description: This attribute identifies the IP address that needs to be matched against in this network list for the Import policy to be applied to.

vrIpEgpExportRowStatusTable.name: vrIpEgpExportRowStatusTable
vrIpEgpExportRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpEgpExport components.

vrIpEgpExportRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpEgpExportRowStatusEntry
vrIpEgpExportRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpEgpExport component.

vrIpEgpExportRowStatus.name: vrIpEgpExportRowStatus
vrIpEgpExportRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpEgpExport components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpEgpExportComponentName.name: vrIpEgpExportComponentName
vrIpEgpExportComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpEgpExportStorageType.name: vrIpEgpExportStorageType
vrIpEgpExportStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpEgpExport tables.

vrIpEgpExportIndex.name: vrIpEgpExportIndex
vrIpEgpExportIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpEgpExport tables.

vrIpEgpExportProvTable.name: vrIpEgpExportProvTable
vrIpEgpExportProvTable.description: This group contains all the provisioned attributes for the Export component.

vrIpEgpExportAdvertiseStatus.name: vrIpEgpExportAdvertiseStatus
vrIpEgpExportAdvertiseStatus.description: This attribute specifies if the routes that match this export policy are advertised (send) or not advertised (block).

vrIpEgpExportExportMetric.name: vrIpEgpExportExportMetric
vrIpEgpExportExportMetric.description: This attribute specifies the metric to be used on the routes being exported as a result of matching this export policy. If the attribute advertiseStatus is set to block, then the value of exportMetric is ignored. The exportMetric value is not used to select which routes to block or send, but rather the metric value advertised for the routes. A value of 0 indicates that the metric associated with the route in the forwarding table is used.

vrIpEgpExportProtocol.name: vrIpEgpExportProtocol
vrIpEgpExportProtocol.description: This attribute specifies the routes to which this export policy applies based on the routing protocol of how the routes are learned. If it is set to all, this export policy applies to all routes in the forwarding table.

vrIpEgpExportRipInterface.name: vrIpEgpExportRipInterface
vrIpEgpExportRipInterface.description: This attribute specifies the RIP learned routes to which this export policy applies, based on the RIP interface from which the routes are learned. This attribute can only be non zero when the protocol is set to rip. The value of 0.0.0.0 implies any RIP interface on the same virtual router; otherwise the value of this attribute must match the interface address of a LogicalIf that has a RipIf on the same virtual router.

vrIpEgpExportRipNeighbor.name: vrIpEgpExportRipNeighbor
vrIpEgpExportRipNeighbor.description: This attribute specifies the RIP learned routes to which this export policy applies, based on the RIP neighbor of which the routes are learned from. This attribute can only be non zero when the protocol is set to rip. The value of 0.0.0.0 implies any RIP neighbor.

vrIpEgpExportInEgpAsId.name: vrIpEgpExportInEgpAsId
vrIpEgpExportInEgpAsId.description: This attribute specifies the EGP learned routes to which this export policy applies, based on the EGP autonomous system identifier of which the routes are learned from. This attribute can only be non zero when protocol is set to egp. The value of 0 implies any EGP autonomous system; otherwise the value of this attribute must match the asId of an EGP neighbor on the same virtual router.

vrIpEgpExportOspfTag.name: vrIpEgpExportOspfTag
vrIpEgpExportOspfTag.description: This attribute specifies the OSPF learned external routes to which this export policy applies, based on the learned OSPF tag of the routes. This attribute can only be set to a non default value when protocol is set to ospfExternal. The value of 4294967295 implies any tag.

vrIpEgpExportOutAutonomousSystem.name: vrIpEgpExportOutAutonomousSystem
vrIpEgpExportOutAutonomousSystem.description: This attribute specifies the EGP autonomous system to which routes are exported to as a result of matching this export policy. If the attribute advertiseStatus is set to block, then the value of outAutonomousSystem is ignored. The outAutonomousSystem value is not used to select which routes to block or send but where to export the routes. A value of 0 indicates that the routes are exported to all EGP autonomous systems of which the virtual router is a neighbor. Otherwise, the value of this attribute must match the asId of an EGP neighbor on the same virtual router.

vrIpEgpExportNetRowStatusTable.name: vrIpEgpExportNetRowStatusTable
vrIpEgpExportNetRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpEgpExportNet components.

vrIpEgpExportNetRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpEgpExportNetRowStatusEntry
vrIpEgpExportNetRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpEgpExportNet component.

vrIpEgpExportNetRowStatus.name: vrIpEgpExportNetRowStatus
vrIpEgpExportNetRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpEgpExportNet components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpEgpExportNetComponentName.name: vrIpEgpExportNetComponentName
vrIpEgpExportNetComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpEgpExportNetStorageType.name: vrIpEgpExportNetStorageType
vrIpEgpExportNetStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpEgpExportNet tables.

vrIpEgpExportNetIndex.name: vrIpEgpExportNetIndex
vrIpEgpExportNetIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpEgpExportNet tables.

vrIpEgpExportNetProvTable.name: vrIpEgpExportNetProvTable
vrIpEgpExportNetProvTable.description: This group identifies the set of provisionable attributes for the ExportNetworkList component.

vrIpEgpExportNetIpAddress.name: vrIpEgpExportNetIpAddress
vrIpEgpExportNetIpAddress.description: This attribute identifies the 32 bit IP address to match against.

vrIpOspfRowStatusTable.name: vrIpOspfRowStatusTable
vrIpOspfRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpOspf components.

vrIpOspfRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpOspfRowStatusEntry
vrIpOspfRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpOspf component.

vrIpOspfRowStatus.name: vrIpOspfRowStatus
vrIpOspfRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpOspf components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpOspfComponentName.name: vrIpOspfComponentName
vrIpOspfComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpOspfStorageType.name: vrIpOspfStorageType
vrIpOspfStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpOspf tables.

vrIpOspfIndex.name: vrIpOspfIndex
vrIpOspfIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpOspf tables.

vrIpOspfProvTable.name: vrIpOspfProvTable
vrIpOspfProvTable.description: This group of attributes are used to configure the OSPF component.

vrIpOspfRouterId.name: vrIpOspfRouterId
vrIpOspfRouterId.description: This attribute is an Ip Address that uniquely identifies the router in the autonomous system.

vrIpOspfSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrIpOspfSnmpAdminStatus
vrIpOspfSnmpAdminStatus.description: The administrative status of the OSPF Component in this Virtual Router.

vrIpOspfAsBdrRtrStatus.name: vrIpOspfAsBdrRtrStatus
vrIpOspfAsBdrRtrStatus.description: This attribute is a flag to note whether this router is an autonomous system border router. If this router is configured to export any routes learned from other than OSPF-internal protocol, this attribute should be configured as autonomous system border router.

vrIpOspfTosSupport.name: vrIpOspfTosSupport
vrIpOspfTosSupport.description: The router's support for type-of-service routing. Only one value will be allowed. This is a deviation from supporting the MIB.

vrIpOspfExtLsdbLimit.name: vrIpOspfExtLsdbLimit
vrIpOspfExtLsdbLimit.description: The maximum number of external link-state entries that can be stored in the link-state database. If the value is -1, then there is no limit, that is the maximum number of external OSPF routes that this autonomous system border router will originate. It will begin to flush LSA(Link State Advertisement)s, if an ASBR might receive bursts of external routes (for example, a regional network), then the parameter should be configured to a reasonable level. If there are less than two thousand routes and large bursts are unlikely, then the default should be adequate. This parameter will not affect the number of external OSPF routes a router will store in it's database.

vrIpOspfMulticastForward.name: vrIpOspfMulticastForward
vrIpOspfMulticastForward.description: A bit mask indicating the limits on Network Layer Multicast(class D) forwarding. It is represented as a sum of the following: if intra-Area forwarding is permitted, 1; else 0 if inter-Area forwarding is permitted 2; else 0 if inter-AS forwarding is permitted, 4; else 0 Only the value of 0 is being supported and this is a MIB deviation.

vrIpOspfMigrateRip.name: vrIpOspfMigrateRip
vrIpOspfMigrateRip.description: This Attribute sets the preference level of OSPF-internal routes to be less preferred than RIP. This Parameter should only be used when starting migration of network from RIP to OSPF. When ready to cutover to OSPF, set this attribute disabled and run under normal preferences. All OSPF routers in the Autonomous System should be running with migraterip enabled or with migraterip disabled to prevent routing loops. It is important that the changeover period from RIP to OSPF be performed quickly on all OSPF routers so that no routing loops are formed. These routing loops could be caused by conflicts in the internal RIP and OSPF databases.

vrIpOspfGenerateDefaultRouteMetric.name: vrIpOspfGenerateDefaultRouteMetric
vrIpOspfGenerateDefaultRouteMetric.description: If this router is configured as an autonomous system border router, then this attribute causes the default route to be generated with a metric value equal to generateDefaultRouteMetric value. This route is put in the OSPF update along with the normal update routes when updates are sent to the neighbors. No default route will be generated if the value is 0.

vrIpOspfOperTable.name: vrIpOspfOperTable
vrIpOspfOperTable.description: These group of attributes identifies the operational attributes for this OSPF Component.

vrIpOspfVersionNumber.name: vrIpOspfVersionNumber
vrIpOspfVersionNumber.description: The Current Version number of the OSPF Protocol. (2).

vrIpOspfAreaBdrRtrStatus.name: vrIpOspfAreaBdrRtrStatus
vrIpOspfAreaBdrRtrStatus.description: This attribute is used to specify whether this router is configured as an area border router.

vrIpOspfExternLsaCount.name: vrIpOspfExternLsaCount
vrIpOspfExternLsaCount.description: The number of external (LS type 5) link-state advertisements in the link- state database.

vrIpOspfExternLsaChecksumSum.name: vrIpOspfExternLsaChecksumSum
vrIpOspfExternLsaChecksumSum.description: The 32-bit unsigned sum of the LS checksums of the external link-state database. This sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state database, and to compare the link-state database of two routers.

vrIpOspfOriginateNewLsas.name: vrIpOspfOriginateNewLsas
vrIpOspfOriginateNewLsas.description: The number of new link-state advertisements that have been originated. This number is incremented each time the router originates a new LSA.

vrIpOspfRxNewLsas.name: vrIpOspfRxNewLsas
vrIpOspfRxNewLsas.description: The number of link-state advertisements received determined to be new instantiations. This number does not include newer instantiations of self- originated link-state advertisements.

vrIpOspfStateTable.name: vrIpOspfStateTable
vrIpOspfStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

vrIpOspfAdminState.name: vrIpOspfAdminState
vrIpOspfAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

vrIpOspfOperationalState.name: vrIpOspfOperationalState
vrIpOspfOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

vrIpOspfUsageState.name: vrIpOspfUsageState
vrIpOspfUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

vrIpOspfOperStatusTable.name: vrIpOspfOperStatusTable
vrIpOspfOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

vrIpOspfSnmpOperStatus.name: vrIpOspfSnmpOperStatus
vrIpOspfSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrIpOspfAreaRowStatusTable.name: vrIpOspfAreaRowStatusTable
vrIpOspfAreaRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpOspfArea components.

vrIpOspfAreaRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpOspfAreaRowStatusEntry
vrIpOspfAreaRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpOspfArea component.

vrIpOspfAreaRowStatus.name: vrIpOspfAreaRowStatus
vrIpOspfAreaRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpOspfArea components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpOspfAreaComponentName.name: vrIpOspfAreaComponentName
vrIpOspfAreaComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpOspfAreaStorageType.name: vrIpOspfAreaStorageType
vrIpOspfAreaStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpOspfArea tables.

vrIpOspfAreaAreaIdIndex.name: vrIpOspfAreaAreaIdIndex
vrIpOspfAreaAreaIdIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpOspfArea tables.

vrIpOspfAreaProvTable.name: vrIpOspfAreaProvTable
vrIpOspfAreaProvTable.description: This group describes the set of provisionable attributes for the AreaEntry Component.

vrIpOspfAreaAuthType.name: vrIpOspfAreaAuthType
vrIpOspfAreaAuthType.description: The authentication type specified for this area.

vrIpOspfAreaImportAsExtern.name: vrIpOspfAreaImportAsExtern
vrIpOspfAreaImportAsExtern.description: The area's support for importing AS external link-state advertisements. For backbone area (that is, areaId 0.0.0.0), this attribute must be set to importExternal.

vrIpOspfAreaAreaSummary.name: vrIpOspfAreaAreaSummary
vrIpOspfAreaAreaSummary.description: This variable controls the import of summary LSAs into stub areas. If it is noAreaSummary, the router will neither originate nor propagate summary LSAs into the stub areas. It will rely entirely on its default route. If it is sendAreaSummary, the router will both summarize and propagate summary LSAs.

vrIpOspfAreaOperTable.name: vrIpOspfAreaOperTable
vrIpOspfAreaOperTable.description: This group of attributes describes the Operational set of attributes for the AreaEntry component.

vrIpOspfAreaSpfRuns.name: vrIpOspfAreaSpfRuns
vrIpOspfAreaSpfRuns.description: The number of times that the intra-area route table has been calculated using this area's link-state database since the protocol became operational.

vrIpOspfAreaAreaBdrRtrCount.name: vrIpOspfAreaAreaBdrRtrCount
vrIpOspfAreaAreaBdrRtrCount.description: The total number of area border routers reachable within this area. This is initially zero, and is calculated in each Shortest Path First Pass.

vrIpOspfAreaAsBdrRtrCount.name: vrIpOspfAreaAsBdrRtrCount
vrIpOspfAreaAsBdrRtrCount.description: The total number of Autonomous System border routers reachable within this area. This is initially zero, and is calculated in each Shortest Path First Pass.

vrIpOspfAreaLsaCount.name: vrIpOspfAreaLsaCount
vrIpOspfAreaLsaCount.description: The total number of link-state advertisements in this area's link-state database, excluding AS External LSA's.

vrIpOspfAreaAreaLsaCksumSum.name: vrIpOspfAreaAreaLsaCksumSum
vrIpOspfAreaAreaLsaCksumSum.description: The 32-bit unsigned sum of the link-state advertisement's LS checksums contained in this area's link-state database. This sum excludes external (LS type 5) link-state advertisements. The sum can be used to determine if there has been a change in a router's link state database, and to compare the link-state database of two routers.

vrIpOspfStubRowStatusTable.name: vrIpOspfStubRowStatusTable
vrIpOspfStubRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpOspfStub components.

vrIpOspfStubRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpOspfStubRowStatusEntry
vrIpOspfStubRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpOspfStub component.

vrIpOspfStubRowStatus.name: vrIpOspfStubRowStatus
vrIpOspfStubRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpOspfStub components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpOspfStubComponentName.name: vrIpOspfStubComponentName
vrIpOspfStubComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpOspfStubStorageType.name: vrIpOspfStubStorageType
vrIpOspfStubStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpOspfStub tables.

vrIpOspfStubAreaIdIndex.name: vrIpOspfStubAreaIdIndex
vrIpOspfStubAreaIdIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfStub tables.

vrIpOspfStubTosIndex.name: vrIpOspfStubTosIndex
vrIpOspfStubTosIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfStub tables.

vrIpOspfStubProvTable.name: vrIpOspfStubProvTable
vrIpOspfStubProvTable.description: These set of attributes explain the provisionable group for the StubAreaEntry.

vrIpOspfStubMetric.name: vrIpOspfStubMetric
vrIpOspfStubMetric.description: The metric value applied at the indicated type of service.

vrIpOspfStubMetricType.name: vrIpOspfStubMetricType
vrIpOspfStubMetricType.description: This type of the metric advertised as a default route.

vrIpOspfStubAdvertiseDefault.name: vrIpOspfStubAdvertiseDefault
vrIpOspfStubAdvertiseDefault.description: This attribute determines whether or not the default routing information will be advertised, depending on other criterion. Setting this value to no can prevent advertising default routing information. If the value of the attribute is set to yes, then the value of the attribute importAsExtern for that particular AreaEntry should be set to importNssa.

vrIpOspfAggregateRowStatusTable.name: vrIpOspfAggregateRowStatusTable
vrIpOspfAggregateRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpOspfAggregate components.

vrIpOspfAggregateRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpOspfAggregateRowStatusEntry
vrIpOspfAggregateRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpOspfAggregate component.

vrIpOspfAggregateRowStatus.name: vrIpOspfAggregateRowStatus
vrIpOspfAggregateRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpOspfAggregate components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpOspfAggregateComponentName.name: vrIpOspfAggregateComponentName
vrIpOspfAggregateComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpOspfAggregateStorageType.name: vrIpOspfAggregateStorageType
vrIpOspfAggregateStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpOspfAggregate tables.

vrIpOspfAggregateAreaIdIndex.name: vrIpOspfAggregateAreaIdIndex
vrIpOspfAggregateAreaIdIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfAggregate tables.

vrIpOspfAggregateLsdbTypeIndex.name: vrIpOspfAggregateLsdbTypeIndex
vrIpOspfAggregateLsdbTypeIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfAggregate tables.

vrIpOspfAggregateAggregateNetIndex.name: vrIpOspfAggregateAggregateNetIndex
vrIpOspfAggregateAggregateNetIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfAggregate tables.

vrIpOspfAggregateAggregateMaskIndex.name: vrIpOspfAggregateAggregateMaskIndex
vrIpOspfAggregateAggregateMaskIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfAggregate tables.

vrIpOspfAggregateEffect.description: This attribute determines whether or not the routing information will be advertised, depending on other criterion. Setting this value to doNotAdvertiseMatching can prevent advertising routing information for the address and mask values specified as the indices for this entry.

vrIpOspfVirtIfNbrRouterIdIndex.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfNbrRouterIdIndex
vrIpOspfVirtIfNbrRouterIdIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfVirtIf tables.

vrIpOspfVirtIfProvTable.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfProvTable
vrIpOspfVirtIfProvTable.description: This group of attributes provide provisioning data for the VirtIfEntry.

vrIpOspfVirtIfTransitDelay.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfTransitDelay
vrIpOspfVirtIfTransitDelay.description: The estimated number of seconds it takes to transmit a link-state update packet over this interface.

vrIpOspfVirtIfRetransInterval.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfRetransInterval
vrIpOspfVirtIfRetransInterval.description: The number of seconds between link-state advertisement retransmissions, for adjacencies belonging to this interface. This value is also used when retransmitting database description and link-state request packets. This value would be well over the expected round-trip time.

vrIpOspfVirtIfHelloInterval.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfHelloInterval
vrIpOspfVirtIfHelloInterval.description: The length of time, in seconds, between the Hello packets that the router sends on the interface. This value must be the same for the virtual neighbor.

vrIpOspfVirtIfRtrDeadInterval.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfRtrDeadInterval
vrIpOspfVirtIfRtrDeadInterval.description: The number of seconds that a router's Hello packets have not been seen before its neighbors declare the router down. This should be some multiple of the Hello interval. This value must be the same for the virtual neighbor.

vrIpOspfVirtIfAuthKey.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfAuthKey
vrIpOspfVirtIfAuthKey.description: If authentication type is simple password, the password for this virtual circuit. If the value of the attribute is not set, then this attribute is ignored by the application. If the value of this attribute is set, then the value of the attribute authType under this particular Area should be set to simplePassword, otherwise the application will ignore this authentication key.

vrIpOspfVirtIfOperTable.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfOperTable
vrIpOspfVirtIfOperTable.description: Represents a group of operational attributes for the VirtIfEntry component.

vrIpOspfVirtIfState.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfState
vrIpOspfVirtIfState.description: The state of the OSPF virtual interface.

vrIpOspfVirtIfEvents.name: vrIpOspfVirtIfEvents
vrIpOspfVirtIfEvents.description: The number of state changes or error events on the virtual link.

vrIpOspfExportRowStatusTable.name: vrIpOspfExportRowStatusTable
vrIpOspfExportRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpOspfExport components.

vrIpOspfExportRowStatusEntry.description: A single entry in the table represents a single vrIpOspfExport component.

vrIpOspfExportRowStatus.name: vrIpOspfExportRowStatus
vrIpOspfExportRowStatus.description: This variable is used as the basis for SNMP naming of vrIpOspfExport components. These components can be added and deleted.

vrIpOspfExportComponentName.name: vrIpOspfExportComponentName
vrIpOspfExportComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpOspfExportStorageType.name: vrIpOspfExportStorageType
vrIpOspfExportStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpOspfExport tables.

vrIpOspfExportIndex.name: vrIpOspfExportIndex
vrIpOspfExportIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpOspfExport tables.

vrIpOspfExportProvTable.name: vrIpOspfExportProvTable
vrIpOspfExportProvTable.description: This Group contains all the Provisioned attributes for the Export Component.

vrIpOspfExportAdvertiseStatus.name: vrIpOspfExportAdvertiseStatus
vrIpOspfExportAdvertiseStatus.description: This attribute specifies if the routes that match this export policy are advertised (send) or not advertised (block).

vrIpOspfExportMetric.name: vrIpOspfExportMetric
vrIpOspfExportMetric.description: This attribute specifies the metric to be used on the routes being exported as a result of matching this export policy. If the attribute advertiseStatus is set to block, then the value of metric is ignored. The metric value is not used to select which routes to block or send, but rather the metric value advertised for the routes. A value of -1 indicates that the metric associated with the route in the forwarding table is used.

vrIpOspfExportProtocol.name: vrIpOspfExportProtocol
vrIpOspfExportProtocol.description: This attribute specifies the routes to which this export policy applies based on the routing protocol of how the routes are learned. If it is set to all, this export policy applies to all routes in the forwarding table.

vrIpOspfExportRipInterface.name: vrIpOspfExportRipInterface
vrIpOspfExportRipInterface.description: This attribute specifies the RIP learned routes to which this export policy applies, based on the RIP interface from which the routes are learned. This attribute can only be non zero when the protocol is set to rip. The value of 0.0.0.0 implies any RIP interface on the same virtual router; otherwise the value of this attribute must match the interface address of a LogicalIf that has a RipIf on the same virtual router.

vrIpOspfExportRipNeighbor.name: vrIpOspfExportRipNeighbor
vrIpOspfExportRipNeighbor.description: This attribute specifies the RIP learned routes to which this export policy applies, based on the RIP neighbor of which the routes are learned from. This attribute can only be non zero when the protocol is set to rip. The value of 0.0.0.0 implies any RIP neighbor.

vrIpOspfExportEgpAsId.name: vrIpOspfExportEgpAsId
vrIpOspfExportEgpAsId.description: This attribute specifies the EGP learned routes to which this export policy applies, based on the EGP autonomous system identifier of which the routes are learned from. This attribute can only be non zero when protocol is set to egp. The value of 0 implies any EGP autonomous system; otherwise the value of this attribute must match the asId of an EGP neighbor on the same virtual router.

vrIpOspfExportTag.name: vrIpOspfExportTag
vrIpOspfExportTag.description: This attribute specifies the OSPF tag to be used on the routes being exported as a result of matching this export policy. If the attribute advertiseStatus is set to block, then the value of tag is ignored. The tag value is not used to select which routes to block or send, but rather the tag value advertised for the routes. A value of 4294967295 indicates that the tag associated with the route in the forwarding table is used.

vrIpOspfExportExtLsaMetricType.name: vrIpOspfExportExtLsaMetricType
vrIpOspfExportExtLsaMetricType.description: This attribute specifies the metric type in the OSPF external link state advertisement of the routes being exported as a result of matching this export policy. If the attribute advertiseStatus is set to block, then the value of extLsaMetricType is ignored. The extLsaMetricType value is not used to select which routes to block or send, but rather the metric value advertised for the routes. The value useProtocolDefault indicates the metric type is automatically chosen based on the routing protocol which the route was learned from.

vrIpOspfExportBgpAsId.name: vrIpOspfExportBgpAsId
vrIpOspfExportBgpAsId.description: This key attribute specifies the bgp AS from which a bgp route is learned from. This key is used only if the protocol is bgpExternal. bgpAsId of value 0 mathces all ASs.

vrIpOspfExportBgpPeerIp.name: vrIpOspfExportBgpPeerIp
vrIpOspfExportBgpPeerIp.description: This key attribute specifies the bgp peer where the routes were learned from. bgpPeerIp of 0 matches all bgp peers. This attribute is used as a key when protocol is set to bgpInternal or bgpExternal.

vrIpOspfExportNetListStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpOspfExportNetList tables.

vrIpOspfExportNetListIndex.name: vrIpOspfExportNetListIndex
vrIpOspfExportNetListIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpOspfExportNetList tables.

vrIpOspfExportNetListProvTable.name: vrIpOspfExportNetListProvTable
vrIpOspfExportNetListProvTable.description: This group identifies the set of provisionable attributes for the ExportNetworkList component.

vrIpOspfExportNetListIpAddress.name: vrIpOspfExportNetListIpAddress
vrIpOspfExportNetListIpAddress.description: This attribute identifies the 32 bit IP address to match against.

vrIpOspfExportNetListIpMask.name: vrIpOspfExportNetListIpMask
vrIpOspfExportNetListIpMask.description: This attribute is the IP Mask to be used with the IP Address to match against.

vrIpOspfVirtNbrAreaIdIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfVirtNbr tables.

vrIpOspfVirtNbrNbrRouterIdIndex.name: vrIpOspfVirtNbrNbrRouterIdIndex
vrIpOspfVirtNbrNbrRouterIdIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfVirtNbr tables.

vrIpOspfVirtNbrOperTable.name: vrIpOspfVirtNbrOperTable
vrIpOspfVirtNbrOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This group identifies a set of operational attributes.

vrIpOspfVirtNbrNbrIpAddress.name: vrIpOspfVirtNbrNbrIpAddress
vrIpOspfVirtNbrNbrIpAddress.description: Indicates the Ip address this interface this virtual neighbor is using.

vrIpOspfVirtNbrOptions.name: vrIpOspfVirtNbrOptions
vrIpOspfVirtNbrOptions.description: A bit mask corresponding to the neighbor's options field. Bit 1, if set indicates that the system will operate on Type of Service metrics other than TOS 0. If zero, the neighbor will ignore all metrics except the TOS 0 metric. Bit 2, if set, indicates that the system is Network Multicast capable; i.e., that it implements OSPF Multicast Routing.

vrIpOspfVirtNbrState.name: vrIpOspfVirtNbrState
vrIpOspfVirtNbrState.description: The state of the virtual neighbor relationship.

vrIpOspfVirtNbrEvents.name: vrIpOspfVirtNbrEvents
vrIpOspfVirtNbrEvents.description: The number of times this virtual link has changed its state, or an error has occurred.

vrIpOspfVirtNbrLsRetransQlen.name: vrIpOspfVirtNbrLsRetransQlen
vrIpOspfVirtNbrLsRetransQlen.description: The current length of the Retransmission queue.

vrIpOspfVirtNbrExchangeStatus.name: vrIpOspfVirtNbrExchangeStatus
vrIpOspfVirtNbrExchangeStatus.description: Indicates the exchange status of the entry in this table.

vrIpOspfNbrStorageType.name: vrIpOspfNbrStorageType
vrIpOspfNbrStorageType.description: This variable represents the storage type value for the vrIpOspfNbr tables.

vrIpOspfNbrAddressIndex.name: vrIpOspfNbrAddressIndex
vrIpOspfNbrAddressIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfNbr tables.

vrIpOspfNbrAddressLessIndex.name: vrIpOspfNbrAddressLessIndex
vrIpOspfNbrAddressLessIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfNbr tables.

vrIpOspfNbrOperTable.name: vrIpOspfNbrOperTable
vrIpOspfNbrOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This group identifies the operational set of attributes for the NeighborEntry.

vrIpOspfNbrRtrId.name: vrIpOspfNbrRtrId
vrIpOspfNbrRtrId.description: An Ip Address that uniquely identifies the neighboring router in the autonomous system.

vrIpOspfNbrOptions.name: vrIpOspfNbrOptions
vrIpOspfNbrOptions.description: A bit mask corresponding to the neighbor's options field. Bit 0, if set, indicates that the area accepts and operates on external information, if zero, it is a stub area. Bit 1, if set, indicates that the system will operate on Type of Service metrics other than TOS 0. If zero, the neighbor will ignore all metrics except the TOS 0 metric. Bit 2, if set, indicates that the system is Network Multicast capable; i.e., that it implements OSPF Multicast Routing.

vrIpOspfNbrPriority.name: vrIpOspfNbrPriority
vrIpOspfNbrPriority.description: The priority of this neighbor in the designated router election algorithm. The value 0 signifies that the neighbor is not eligible to become the designated router on this particular network.

vrIpOspfNbrState.name: vrIpOspfNbrState
vrIpOspfNbrState.description: The state of the relationship with this neighbor.

vrIpOspfNbrEvents.name: vrIpOspfNbrEvents
vrIpOspfNbrEvents.description: The number of times this neighbor relationship has changed state, or an error has occurred.

vrIpOspfNbrLsRetransQlen.name: vrIpOspfNbrLsRetransQlen
vrIpOspfNbrLsRetransQlen.description: The current length of the Retransmission queue.

vrIpOspfNbrNbmaNbrStatus.name: vrIpOspfNbrNbmaNbrStatus
vrIpOspfNbrNbmaNbrStatus.description: This attribute describes the status of the entry.

vrIpOspfNbrExchangeStatus.name: vrIpOspfNbrExchangeStatus
vrIpOspfNbrExchangeStatus.description: Indicates the exchange status for a neighbor entry.

vrIpOspfNbrPermanence.name: vrIpOspfNbrPermanence
vrIpOspfNbrPermanence.description: This attribute displays how the neighbor became an entry.

vrIpOspfLsdbRowStatusTable.name: vrIpOspfLsdbRowStatusTable
vrIpOspfLsdbRowStatusTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpOspfLsdb components.

vrIpOspfLsdbLsIdIndex.name: vrIpOspfLsdbLsIdIndex
vrIpOspfLsdbLsIdIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfLsdb tables.

vrIpOspfLsdbRouterIdIndex.name: vrIpOspfLsdbRouterIdIndex
vrIpOspfLsdbRouterIdIndex.description: This variable represents an index for the vrIpOspfLsdb tables.

vrIpOspfLsdbOperTable.name: vrIpOspfLsdbOperTable
vrIpOspfLsdbOperTable.description: *** THIS TABLE CURRENTLY NOT IMPLEMENTED *** This group describes the Operational set of attributes for the LsdbEntry.

vrIpOspfLsdbSequence.name: vrIpOspfLsdbSequence
vrIpOspfLsdbSequence.description: A signed 32-bit integer, used to detect old and duplicate LSAs. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number, the more recent the advertisement.

vrIpOspfLsdbAge.name: vrIpOspfLsdbAge
vrIpOspfLsdbAge.description: The age of the Link State Advertisement in seconds.

vrIpOspfLsdbChecksum.name: vrIpOspfLsdbChecksum
vrIpOspfLsdbChecksum.description: The checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The checksum used is the Fletcher checksum.

vrIpOspfLsdbAdvertisement.name: vrIpOspfLsdbAdvertisement
vrIpOspfLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire LSA including its header.

vrIpOspfExtLsdbRouterIdIndex.name: vrIpOspfExtLsdbRouterIdIndex

vrIpOspfExtLsdbSequence.description: A signed 32-bit integer, used to detect old and duplicate LSAs. The space of sequence numbers is linearly ordered. The larger the sequence number, the more recent the advertisement.

vrIpOspfExtLsdbAge.description: The age of the Link State Advertisement in seconds.

vrIpOspfExtLsdbChecksum.description: The checksum of the complete contents of the advertisement, excepting the age field. The checksum used is the Fletcher checksum.

vrIpOspfExtLsdbAdvertisement.description: The entire LSA including its header.

vrIpRipProvTable.name: vrIpRipProvTable
vrIpRipProvTable.description: This group contains the provisionable attributes for the RIP component

vrIpRipMigrateRip.name: vrIpRipMigrateRip
vrIpRipMigrateRip.description: This attribute sets the preference level of OSPF-internal routes to be less preferred than RIP. Note: This parameter should only be used when starting migration of network from RIP to OSPF. When ready to cutover to OSPF, set this attribute value to disabled and run under normal preferences. All OSPF routers in the Autonomous System should be running with migrateRip enabled or with migrateRip disabled to prevent routing loops. It is important that the changeover period from RIP to OSPF be performed quickly on all OSPF routers so that no routing loops are formed. These routing loops could be caused by conflicts in the internal RIP and OSPF databases.

vrIpRipRfc1058MetricUsage.name: vrIpRipRfc1058MetricUsage
vrIpRipRfc1058MetricUsage.description: This attribute determines the metric usage for this RIP instance. This flag is used to determine the way metrics are incremented. RFC1058 way : Sending Update: This is to use the metric for the route from the routing table as the advertised metric to be sent for that route. Nothing is ever added to this value from the sending side. The only special case handling is that if the route being advertised is the network route of a directly connectednetwork, the metric in the routing table will be zero. Then the RipIf interface metric for the interface being advertised is used as the advertise metric. If the interface being advertised is not a Rip interface, then metric value of 1 is used. Receiving Update: Add receiving interface's RIP metric to the metric for the route in the received advertisement and install the result in the receiver's routing table as the metric for that route. Older way: Sending Updates: Add the out going interfaces rip metric to the metric for a route in the routing table to form the metric to be advertised for that route. Receiving Updates: The metric received in the advertisement for a route is put directly in the routing table as the metric for that route. Note: It is recommended that, all the routers in this autonomous system should be following the rfc1058 metric system. Setting this flag to disabled will have the effect of running the RIP with old metric incrementing system.

vrIpRipGenerateDiscardRoute.name: vrIpRipGenerateDiscardRoute
vrIpRipGenerateDiscardRoute.description: This attribute when set to yes will add network disacrd routes to the routing and forwarding table for the subnetted interfaces that are running RIP.

vrIpRipRipUpdate.name: vrIpRipRipUpdate
vrIpRipRipUpdate.description: This attribute sets the interval for sending updates bewteen RIP neighbours. Set this attribute with a value less than that of the timeout and garbage collect timers. The ripUpdate timer starts when a route comes up and when updates are received.

vrIpRipRipTimeout.name: vrIpRipRipTimeout
vrIpRipRipTimeout.description: This attribute sets the RIP timeout interval. If this timer expires, the route is no longer valid. The ripTimeout timer starts when a route comes up and when updates are received.

vrIpRipGarbageCollectTimer.name: vrIpRipGarbageCollectTimer
vrIpRipGarbageCollectTimer.description: This attribute sets the interval between a route's timeout expiring and the deletion of that route's information from the routing table. The garbage collect timer starts when the ripTimeout period expires.

vrIpRipStateTable.name: vrIpRipStateTable
vrIpRipStateTable.description: This group contains the three OSI State attributes. The descriptions generically indicate what each state attribute implies about the component. Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

vrIpRipAdminState.name: vrIpRipAdminState
vrIpRipAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

vrIpRipOperationalState.name: vrIpRipOperationalState
vrIpRipOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

vrIpRipUsageState.name: vrIpRipUsageState
vrIpRipUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

vrIpRipAdminControlTable.name: vrIpRipAdminControlTable
vrIpRipAdminControlTable.description: This group includes the Administrative Control attribute. This attribute defines the current administrative state of this component.

vrIpRipSnmpAdminStatus.name: vrIpRipSnmpAdminStatus
vrIpRipSnmpAdminStatus.description: The desired state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and packet forwarding is allowed. The down state indicates the interface is not operational and packet forwarding is unavailable. The testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrIpRipOperStatusTable.name: vrIpRipOperStatusTable
vrIpRipOperStatusTable.description: This group includes the Operational Status attribute. This attribute defines the current operational state of this component.

vrIpRipSnmpOperStatus.name: vrIpRipSnmpOperStatus
vrIpRipSnmpOperStatus.description: The current state of the interface. The up state indicates the interface is operational and capable of forwarding packets. The down state indicates the interface is not operational, thus unable to forward packets. testing state indicates that no operational packets can be passed.

vrIpRipOperTable.name: vrIpRipOperTable
vrIpRipOperTable.description: This group defines a set of operational attributes belonging to the RIP component. It corresponds to the rip2Globals table in the RIP-2 standard MIB.

vrIpRipRouteChangesMade.name: vrIpRipRouteChangesMade
vrIpRipRouteChangesMade.description: This attribute counts the route changes made to the IP Route Database by Rip. This does not include the refresh of the route's age.

vrIpRipQueryResponses.name: vrIpRipQueryResponses
vrIpRipQueryResponses.description: This attribute counts the responses sent to RIP queries from other systems.

vrIpRipImportUsageFlag.name: vrIpRipImportUsageFlag
vrIpRipImportUsageFlag.description: This flag when set to ignore indicates the routes that are not used and if set to use, indicates the routes which are used.

vrIpRipImportImportMetric.name: vrIpRipImportImportMetric
vrIpRipImportImportMetric.description: This attribute is used to override the default import metric for the RIP protocol. This value is not used to select which routes to use or ignore, rather it is the metric to be used in the routing table for the routes imported for this import policy. A value of zero indicates that the metric received in the update will be used.

vrIpRipImportNeighbor.name: vrIpRipImportNeighbor
vrIpRipImportNeighbor.description: This attribute indicates the IP Address of the neighbor this policy will apply to.

vrIpRipImportInterface.name: vrIpRipImportInterface
vrIpRipImportInterface.description: This attribute specifies the RIP interface to which this import policy applies. The value of 0.0.0.0 implies any RIP interface on the virtual router; otherwise the value of this attribute must match the interface address of a LogicalIf that has a RipIf on the same virtual router.

vrIpRipImportNetRowStatusTable.name: vrIpRipImportNetRowStatusTable
vrIpRipImportNetRowStatusTable.description: This entry controls the addition and deletion of vrIpRipImportNet components.

vrIpRipImportNetIndex.description: This variable represents the index for the vrIpRipImportNet tables.

vrIpRipImportNetProvTable.description: This group contains attributes for the XXXX NetworkList component for the Import Policy to be applied to

vrIpRipImportNetIpAddress.description: This attribute specifies the IP address that needs to be matched against in this network list for the Import Policy to be applied to.

vrIpRipImportNetIpMask.name: vrIpRipImportNetIpMask
vrIpRipImportNetIpMask.description: This attribute specifies the IP mask for the attribute ipAddress.

vrIpRipExportAdvertiseStatus.name: vrIpRipExportAdvertiseStatus
vrIpRipExportAdvertiseStatus.description: This attribute specifies if the routes that match this export policy are advertised (send) or not advertised (block).

vrIpRipExportExportMetric.name: vrIpRipExportExportMetric
vrIpRipExportExportMetric.description: This attribute specifies the metric to be used on the routes being exported as a result of matching this export policy. If the attribute advertiseStatus is set to block, then the value of exportMetric is ignored. The exportMetric value is not used to select which routes to block or send, but rather the metric value advertised for the routes. A value of 0 indicates that the metric associated with the route in the forwarding table is used.

vrIpRipExportProtocol.name: vrIpRipExportProtocol
vrIpRipExportProtocol.description: This attribute specifies the routes to which this export policy applies based on the routing protocol of how the routes are learned. If it is set to all, this export policy applies to all routes in the forwarding table.

vrIpRipExportRipInterface.name: vrIpRipExportRipInterface
vrIpRipExportRipInterface.description: This attribute specifies the RIP learned routes to which this export policy applies, based on the RIP interface from which the routes are learned. This attribute can only be non zero when the protocol is set to rip. The value of 0.0.0.0 implies any RIP interface on the same virtual router; otherwise the value of this attribute must match the interface address of a LogicalIf that has a RipIf on the same virtual router. DESCRIPTION

vrIpRipExportEgpAsId.name: vrIpRipExportEgpAsId
vrIpRipExportEgpAsId.description: This attribute specifies the EGP learned routes to which this export policy applies, based on the EGP autonomous system identifier of which the routes are learned from. This attribute can only be non zero when protocol is set to egp. The value of 0 implies any EGP autonomous system; otherwise the value of this attribute must match the asId of an EGP neighbor on the same virtual router.

vrIpRipExportOspfTag.name: vrIpRipExportOspfTag
vrIpRipExportOspfTag.description: This attribute specifies the OSPF learned external routes to which this export policy applies, based on the learned OSPF tag of the routes. This attribute can only be set to a non default value when protocol is set to ospfExternal. The default value of 4294967295 implies any tag.

vrIpRipExportOutInterface.name: vrIpRipExportOutInterface
vrIpRipExportOutInterface.description: This attribute specifies the RIP interface on the virtual router which routes are exported onto as a result of matching this export policy. If the attribute advertiseStatus is set to block, then the value of outInterface is ignored. The outInterface value is not used to select which routes to block or send, but rather where to export the routes. A value of 0.0.0.0 indicates that the routes are exported to all RIP interfaces on the virtual router. Otherwise, the value of this attribute must match the interface address of a LogicalIf that has a RipIf on the same virtual router.

vrIpRipExportBgpAsId.name: vrIpRipExportBgpAsId
vrIpRipExportBgpAsId.description: This key attribute specifies the BGP AS from which the routes are learned. This key will be used only when the protocol is set to bgpExternal. bgpAsId of 0 matches all BGP ASs.

Note that not all the values and state combinations described here are supported by every component which uses this group. For component-specific information and the valid state combinations, refer to NTP 241-7001-150, Passport Operations and Maintenance Guide.

vrIpStaticAdminState.name: vrIpStaticAdminState
vrIpStaticAdminState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Administrative State of the component. The value locked indicates that the component is administratively prohibited from providing services for its users. A Lock or Lock - force command has been previously issued for this component. When the value is locked, the value of usageState must be idle. The value shuttingDown indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide service to its existing users only. A Lock command was issued against the component and it is in the process of shutting down. The value unlocked indicates that the component is administratively permitted to provide services for its users. To enter this state, issue an Unlock command to this component.

vrIpStaticOperationalState.name: vrIpStaticOperationalState
vrIpStaticOperationalState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Operational State of the component. The value enabled indicates that the component is available for operation. Note that if adminState is locked, it would still not be providing service. The value disabled indicates that the component is not available for operation. For example, something is wrong with the component itself, or with another component on which this one depends. If the value is disabled, the usageState must be idle.

vrIpStaticUsageState.name: vrIpStaticUsageState
vrIpStaticUsageState.description: This attribute indicates the OSI Usage State of the component. The value idle indicates that the component is not currently in use. The value active indicates that the component is in use and has spare capacity to provide for additional users. The value busy indicates that the component is in use and has no spare operating capacity for additional users at this time.

vrIpStaticRoutePreferredOver.name: vrIpStaticRoutePreferredOver
vrIpStaticRoutePreferredOver.description: This attribute indicates the preference of the static route in comparison with the OSPF route. intOspf means that the static route is chosen over the OSPF internal route, while extOspf means that the OSPF internal route is chosen over the static route. The default static route preference is set to extOspf .

vrIpNsProvTable.name: vrIpNsProvTable
vrIpNsProvTable.description: This group contains provisionable attributes for the NetSentry component.

vrIpNsFirstFilter.name: vrIpNsFirstFilter
vrIpNsFirstFilter.description: The firstFilter is the first filter point which affects all IP packets before they have been examined in any way for their origin and destination. The most common use of a firstFilter point is to collect statistis for all packets arriving at the route on any interface, before any subsequent filter processing changes their direction or disposition.

vrIpNsLocalInFilter.name: vrIpNsLocalInFilter
vrIpNsLocalInFilter.description: The localInFilter is the second filter point which uses by network administrator to perform a common action on all IP packets that physically arrive over a specific logical interface, regardless of the packet's stated source or destination. Typical uses for a localInFilter include verifying that known Ethernet media source addresses match known IP addresses, or confirming that the IP packet source addresses of received IP packet fall within a narrow range.

vrIpNsLocalOutFilter.name: vrIpNsLocalOutFilter
vrIpNsLocalOutFilter.description: The localOutFilter is the third filter point which applies to any IP packet that will be transmitted from the router to the medium associated with the interface, regardless of its source, destination, or what type of decision was made to cause the datagram to be transmitted on this interface. localOutFilter generally used to ensure that certain paterns of traffic do not enter the network or reach a second IP router on that network. For example, localOutFilter can be used as the exclusion of all IP packets above a certain security classification, or collecting statistics on the amount of IP fragments performed on an outgoing interface.

vrIpNsLastFilter.name: vrIpNsLastFilter
vrIpNsLastFilter.description: lastFilter is the fourth and last filter point to be excecuted after all other routing and filtering decisions have been made on the IP packet, and transmission of the information is imminent. lastFilter is generally used to collect statistics on traffic after all previous control and routing decisions have been made.

vrIpNsApplyRowStatusTable.name: vrIpNsApplyRowStatusTable

vrIpNsApplyProvisionedTable.name: vrIpNsApplyProvisionedTable
vrIpNsApplyProvisionedTable.description: The instance of provisioned information relating to a filter application to IP packet.

vrIpNsApplyFilter.name: vrIpNsApplyFilter
vrIpNsApplyFilter.description: The name of the filter to be applied to packet matching the conditions in this entry.

vrIpNsApplyIpAddress1.name: vrIpNsApplyIpAddress1
vrIpNsApplyIpAddress1.description: The first IP address used to compare.

vrIpNsApplyIpMask1.name: vrIpNsApplyIpMask1
vrIpNsApplyIpMask1.description: The first netmask associated with ipAddress1 used to compare.

vrIpNsApplyIpAddress2.name: vrIpNsApplyIpAddress2
vrIpNsApplyIpAddress2.description: This second IP address used to compare.

vrIpNsApplyIpMask2.name: vrIpNsApplyIpMask2
vrIpNsApplyIpMask2.description: This second netmask associated with ipAddress2 used to compare.

vrIpNsApplyDirection.name: vrIpNsApplyDirection
vrIpNsApplyDirection.description: Indicates the direction a packet must be moving between the first and second apply list entries in order for the entries to match. First 'to' second, first 'from' second, or first 'tofrom' second (either direction).

vrIpArpRowStatusEntry.name: vrIpArpRowStatusEntry

vrIpArpProvTable.name: vrIpArpProvTable
vrIpArpProvTable.description: The ARP refresh feature allows the router to periodically verify ARP table entries. Whenever the router updates an ARP entry, or creates a new entry, a timeout value is assigned to the entry. When the timeout for an entry expires, the router will send a unicast ARP request to the currently-known physical address. If an ARP response comes back, the entry will be assigned a new timeout. If, however, the host has gone away or been assigned a new physical address, the host will not respond to the unicast ARP, and the entry will be removed from the ARP table. The new physical address will be discovered through the normal ARP mechanism when the next communication is attempted to the host.

vrIpArpAutoRefresh.name: vrIpArpAutoRefresh
vrIpArpAutoRefresh.description: This attribute is used to enable or disable the ARP refresh feature.

vrIpArpAutoRefreshTimeout.name: vrIpArpAutoRefreshTimeout
vrIpArpAutoRefreshTimeout.description: This attribute defines the timeout value, in minutes, which is assigned to updated ARP entries, or newly created ARP entries. The range for the timeout is 1 minute to 1440 minutes (24 hours).

vrIpArpHostPhysAddress.name: vrIpArpHostPhysAddress
vrIpArpHostPhysAddress.description: This attribute identifies the physical address of the host being defined. The value for this attribute should only be specified for media types supporting physical addresses (eg. ethernet, fddi, tokenRing etc.)

vrIpArpHostMaxTxUnit.name: vrIpArpHostMaxTxUnit
vrIpArpHostMaxTxUnit.description: Specify the maximum transmit unit (MTU) size that can be accepted by the host. If this value is not specified, the value for the media interface is used. The specified MTU must be less than or equal to the interface's MTU size.

vrIpArpHostPermanentVirtualCircuitNumber.name: vrIpArpHostPermanentVirtualCircuitNumber
vrIpArpHostPermanentVirtualCircuitNumber.description: Specify a permanent virtual circuit number to the remote host on X.25 or frame relay media. The value for this attribute can only be specified for X.25 or frame relay media.

vrIpArpHostEncap.name: vrIpArpHostEncap
vrIpArpHostEncap.description: Specify the encapsulation type for the host. The value for this attribute should only be specified for the hosts on the ethernet media. If a value of auto is specified, the application based on the media will determine the proper applicable encapsulation type.

vrIpArpHostOperTable.name: vrIpArpHostOperTable
vrIpArpHostOperTable.description: This group contains the operational attributes of the HostEntry component.

vrIpArpHostOperMaxTxUnit.name: vrIpArpHostOperMaxTxUnit
vrIpArpHostOperMaxTxUnit.description: This attribute indicates the operational value of the maximum transmission unit.

vrIpArpHostOperEncap.name: vrIpArpHostOperEncap
vrIpArpHostOperEncap.description: This attribute indicates the operational encapsulation type. if the value of the attribute encap is set to auto, then the application will determine the encapsulation type based on the media being used and assigns the appropriate value.

vrIpIcmpSendRedirect.description: This attribute specifies whether an ICMP redirect will be sent. If enabled, the router may send an ICMP redirect if a an Ip packet is being routed out the same logicalInterface as it was received on. The router will only send host ICMP redirects. If disabled, the router will never send a ICMP redirect.

vrIpIcmpInMsgs.description: This attribute indicates the number of ICMP messages received by this gateway. This number includes inErrors. inMsgs wraps to zero if it reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpIcmpInErrors.description: This attribute indicates the number of ICMP messages received by this gateway but determined as having ICMP specific errors such as bad ICMP checksums or bad length. inErrors wraps to zero if it reaches its maximum defined value.

vrIpIcmpInAddrMasks.name: vrIpIcmpInAddrMasks

vrIpIcmpOutParmProbs.name: vrIpIcmpOutParmProbs

vrIpIcmpOutEchos.name: vrIpIcmpOutEchos

vrIpIcmpOutEchoReps.name: vrIpIcmpOutEchoReps

vrIpIcmpOutAddrMasks.name: vrIpIcmpOutAddrMasks

vrIpTcpStatsTable.name: vrIpTcpStatsTable

vrIpTcpRToAlgorithm.name: vrIpTcpRToAlgorithm
vrIpTcpRToAlgorithm.description: Indicate which algorithm was used to calculate the timeout value used for retransmitting unackowledged octet.

vrIpTcpRToMin.name: vrIpTcpRToMin
vrIpTcpRToMin.description: Indicate the minimum value, measured in milliseconds, allowed for retransmission timeout.

vrIpTcpRToMax.name: vrIpTcpRToMax
vrIpTcpRToMax.description: Indicates the maximun value, measured in milliseconds, allowed for retransmission timeout.

vrIpTcpMaxConn.name: vrIpTcpMaxConn
vrIpTcpMaxConn.description: Limit on number of connections the TCP can support. The value is always -1 which indicates that the number of connections supported is dynamic (limited by memory in the system).

vrIpTcpActiveOpens.name: vrIpTcpActiveOpens
vrIpTcpActiveOpens.description: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the synSent state from the closed state.

vrIpTcpPassiveOpens.name: vrIpTcpPassiveOpens
vrIpTcpPassiveOpens.description: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the synRcvd state from the listen state.

vrIpTcpAttemptFails.name: vrIpTcpAttemptFails
vrIpTcpAttemptFails.description: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the closed state from either the synSent state or the synRcvd state, plus the number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the listen state from the synRcvd state.

vrIpTcpEstabResets.name: vrIpTcpEstabResets
vrIpTcpEstabResets.description: The number of times TCP connections have made a direct transition to the closed state from either the established state or the closedWait state.

vrIpTcpCurrEstab.name: vrIpTcpCurrEstab
vrIpTcpCurrEstab.description: The number of TCP connections for which the current state is either established or closedWait.

vrIpTcpInSegs.name: vrIpTcpInSegs
vrIpTcpInSegs.description: The number of segments received, including those received in error. This count includes segments received on currently established connections.

vrIpTcpOutSegs.name: vrIpTcpOutSegs
vrIpTcpOutSegs.description: The number of segments sent, including those on current connections but excluding those containing only retransmitted octets.

vrIpTcpRetransSegs.name: vrIpTcpRetransSegs
vrIpTcpRetransSegs.description: The number of segments retransmitted that is, the number of TCP segments transmitted containing one or more previously transmitted octets.

vrIpTcpInErrs.name: vrIpTcpInErrs
vrIpTcpInErrs.description: Total number of segments received in error, for example bad TCP checksum.

vrIpTcpOutRsts.name: vrIpTcpOutRsts
vrIpTcpOutRsts.description: Number of TCP segments sent containing the RST flag.

vrIpBootpComponentName.description: This variable provides the component's string name for use with the ASCII Console Interface

vrIpBootpStorageType.name: vrIpBootpStorageType
